Try finding by text content all_elements = main_content.find_all(text=re.compile(r&#x27;References?', re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">for text_node "keyword">in all_elements: "keyword">if text_node.strip().lower() == &#x27;references': references_heading = text_node.parent print(f&#x27;‚úì Found References heading by text search: <{references_heading.name}>') "keyword">break "keyword">if references_heading: print(&#x27;\n=== FINDING REFERENCES LIST CONTENT AFTER HEADING ===') # Get the parent element (likely h2 "keyword">or h3) that contains the References heading heading_parent = references_heading.parent print(f&#x27;References heading parent: <{heading_parent.name "keyword">if heading_parent "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}>') # Now find the next sibling elements that contain the actual references potential_ref_containers = [] # Method 1: Direct next sibling of heading parent "keyword">if heading_parent: next_sibling = heading_parent.next_sibling "keyword">while next_sibling: "keyword">if hasattr(next_sibling, &#x27;name') "keyword">and next_sibling.name: # Skip text nodes potential_ref_containers.append((&#x27;Next sibling of heading parent', next_sibling)) "keyword">break next_sibling = next_sibling.next_sibling # Method 2: Find <ol> elements after the references heading "keyword">if heading_parent: following_ols = [] current = heading_parent "keyword">while current "keyword">and current.next_sibling: current = current.next_sibling "keyword">if hasattr(current, &#x27;name') "keyword">and current.name == 'ol': following_ols.append(current) "keyword">elif hasattr(current, &#x27;find_all'): # Check "keyword">if this element contains <ol> elements nested_ols = current.find_all(&#x27;ol') following_ols.extend(nested_ols) "keyword">for ol "keyword">in following_ols: potential_ref_containers.append((&#x27;Following <ol> element', ol)) # Method 3: Look "keyword">for div "keyword">with references-related classes ref_divs = main_content.find_all(&#x27;div', class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and any(term "keyword">in str(x).lower() "keyword">for term "keyword">in ['reference', 'reflist', 'citation'])) "keyword">for div "keyword">in ref_divs: potential_ref_containers.append((&#x27;References div', div)) # Method 4: Look "keyword">for any <ol> "keyword">in the vicinity of references heading "keyword">if heading_parent: nearby_ols = [] # Check parent's parent "keyword">and its siblings grandparent = heading_parent.parent "keyword">if grandparent: "keyword">for sibling "keyword">in grandparent.find_all(&#x27;ol', recursive="keyword">False): nearby_ols.append(sibling) # Also check deeper "keyword">for descendant_ol "keyword">in grandparent.find_all(&#x27;ol'): "keyword">if descendant_ol "keyword">not "keyword">in nearby_ols: nearby_ols.append(descendant_ol) "keyword">for ol "keyword">in nearby_ols: potential_ref_containers.append((&#x27;Nearby <ol> element', ol)) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(potential_ref_containers)} potential reference containers:') "keyword">for i, (method, container) "keyword">in enumerate(potential_ref_containers[:5], 1): # Test each container "keyword">for reference items references_section = "keyword">None ref_items = [] "keyword">for method, container "keyword">in potential_ref_containers: "keyword">try: # Look "keyword">for <li> elements "keyword">in this container li_elements = container.find_all(&#x27;li') "keyword">if hasattr(container, 'find_all') "keyword">else [] "keyword">if li_elements: print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Found {len(li_elements)} <li> elements using: {method}') # Check "keyword">if these look like reference items (contain links "keyword">or citations) valid_refs = [] "keyword">for li "keyword">in li_elements: li_text = li.get_text().strip() li_links = li.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) # Reference items typically have some length "keyword">and may contain links "keyword">if len(li_text) > 20 "keyword">or li_links: # Has substantial text "keyword">or links valid_refs.append(li) "keyword">if valid_refs: references_section = container ref_items = valid_refs print(f&#x27; ‚úì Selected {len(valid_refs)} valid reference items') "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† Found <li> elements but they don\'t look like references') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Error testing {method}: {str(e)}') "keyword">if ref_items: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ SUCCESS: Found {len(ref_items)} reference items') # Show preview of first few reference items print(&#x27;\nFirst 3 reference items:') "keyword">for i, item "keyword">in enumerate(ref_items[:3], 1): preview = item.get_text().strip()[:150] links_count = len(item.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True)) print(f&#x27; {i}. {preview}... (contains {links_count} links)') # Find the first reference (target reference) target_ref_item = ref_items[0] # Use first reference item print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING FIRST REFERENCE ITEM ===') ref_text = target_ref_item.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;Full reference text ({len(ref_text)} chars):') print(&#x27;='*60) print(ref_text) print(&#x27;='*60) # Extract all links "keyword">from first reference all_links = target_ref_item.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(all_links)} links "keyword">in first reference:') external_links = [] "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(all_links, 1): href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link_text}" -> {href}') # Check "keyword">if it's an external link "keyword">if (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">and &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">not "keyword">in href.lower() "keyword">and &#x27;#' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and len(href) > 10): # Reasonable URL length external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;full_tag': str(link) }) print(f&#x27; ‚úì EXTERNAL LINK IDENTIFIED') "keyword">if external_links: first_link = external_links[0] print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK EXTRACTED:') print(f&#x27;Link text: "{first_link["text"]}"') print(f&#x27;URL: {first_link["url"]}') print(f&#x27;Full HTML tag: {first_link["full_tag"]}') # Save complete analysis results analysis_results = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;archive_date': '2023-03-06', &#x27;archive_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel', &#x27;extraction_method': 'References heading + following content parsing', &#x27;extraction_timestamp': '2024-12-19' }, &#x27;first_citation': { &#x27;reference_number': first_citation['number'], &#x27;reference_text': first_citation['text'], &#x27;position_in_text': first_citation['position'] }, &#x27;first_citation_link': { &#x27;url': first_link['url'], &#x27;link_text': first_link['text'], &#x27;full_html_tag': first_link['full_tag'] }, &#x27;reference_item_full_text': ref_text, &#x27;metadata': { &#x27;total_citations_found': len(citation_list), &#x27;total_reference_items': len(ref_items), &#x27;total_links_in_first_ref': len(all_links), &#x27;total_external_links_in_first_ref': len(external_links) } } output_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_citation_link_extracted.json') "keyword">with open(output_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to {os.path.basename(output_file)}') # Show all external links "keyword">if multiple found "keyword">if len(external_links) > 1: print(f&#x27;\nAll {len(external_links)} external links "keyword">in first reference:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(external_links, 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') print(f&#x27;\n*** READY TO PROCEED: First citation link extracted successfully ***') print(f&#x27;Next step: Access URL {first_link["url"]} to examine the target webpage') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No external links found "keyword">in first reference') print(&#x27;This reference may only contain internal Wikipedia links "keyword">or citations without URLs') # Show what links were found "keyword">if all_links: print(&#x27;\nAll links found (none external):') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(all_links, 1): href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') text = link.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. "{text}" -> {href}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No reference items found "keyword">in any potential containers') print(&#x27;\nFinal fallback: searching entire page "keyword">for external links near citations...') # Final fallback: find external links anywhere "keyword">in the page all_page_links = main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) external_page_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in all_page_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">and &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">not "keyword">in href.lower()): external_page_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) print(f&#x27;Found {len(external_page_links)} external links "keyword">in entire page:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(external_page_links[:10], 1): print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') "keyword">if external_page_links: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Using first external link "keyword">from page "keyword">as fallback') fallback_link = external_page_links[0] print(f&#x27;Fallback link: "{fallback_link["text"]}" -> {fallback_link["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå References heading "keyword">not found') print(&#x27;Cannot locate references section to extract citation links') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;REFERENCES PARSING FIX COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Extract first citation reference link by finding actual reference list') print(&#x27;Method: Locate References heading, then find following <ol> "keyword">or <div> "keyword">with reference items')
üìÑ Output

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== FOLLOWING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK FROM CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Access the first citation link "keyword">and examine the target webpage') print(&#x27;Status: Citation link extraction completed, now following the link') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # First, let's inspect the extracted citation data workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Look "keyword">for the citation analysis file citation_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;citation' "keyword">in f "keyword">and f.endswith('.json')] print(f&#x27;\nAvailable citation files: {citation_files}') "keyword">if citation_files: citation_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, citation_files[-1]) # Use most recent print(f&#x27;Loading citation data "keyword">from: {os.path.basename(citation_file)}') # First inspect the file structure "keyword">with open(citation_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: citation_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;\n=== INSPECTING CITATION DATA STRUCTURE ===') print(&#x27;Available keys "keyword">in citation data:') "keyword">for key "keyword">in citation_data.keys(): print(f&#x27; - {key}: {type(citation_data[key])}') # Display the key information "keyword">if &#x27;first_citation_link' "keyword">in citation_data: link_info = citation_data[&#x27;first_citation_link'] print(f&#x27;\nFirst citation link details:') print(f&#x27; URL: {link_info.get("url", "Not found")}') print(f&#x27; Link text: "{link_info.get("link_text", "Not found")}"') print(f&#x27; HTML tag: {link_info.get("full_html_tag", "Not found")}') # Check "keyword">if we have source info "keyword">if &#x27;source_info' "keyword">in citation_data: source_info = citation_data[&#x27;source_info'] print(f&#x27;\nSource information:') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia page: {source_info.get("wikipedia_page", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Archive date: {source_info.get("archive_date", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Archive URL: {source_info.get("archive_url", "Unknown")}') # Display reference item text "keyword">if &#x27;reference_item_full_text' "keyword">in citation_data: ref_text = citation_data[&#x27;reference_item_full_text'] print(f&#x27;\nFirst reference item text:') print(&#x27;='*60) print(ref_text) print(&#x27;='*60) "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No citation analysis files found') # Based on the tester feedback, the first citation was to Thieme-Becker via archive.org # Let's examine what we actually have "keyword">and handle accordingly "keyword">if &#x27;first_citation_link' "keyword">in citation_data "keyword">and citation_data['first_citation_link']['url']: target_url = citation_data[&#x27;first_citation_link']['url'] link_text = citation_data[&#x27;first_citation_link']['link_text'] print(f&#x27;\n=== FOLLOWING FIRST CITATION LINK ===') print(f&#x27;Target URL: {target_url}') print(f&#x27;Link text: "{link_text}"') # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is an archive.org URL pointing to another Wikipedia page "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url "keyword">and 'wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† Note: This "keyword">is an archived Wikipedia page (internal reference)') print(&#x27;This suggests the first citation "keyword">is a cross-reference to another Wikipedia article') print(&#x27;\n=== ACCESSING TARGET WEBPAGE ===') # Set up headers "keyword">for the request headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Referer': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel' } "keyword">try: print(f&#x27;Requesting: {target_url}') response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content-Type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f&#x27;Final URL: {response.url}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(&#x27;\n‚úì Successfully accessed target webpage') # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find(&#x27;title') "keyword">if title: page_title = title.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Remove wayback machine elements "keyword">if present wayback_elements = soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()) print(f&#x27;Removing {len(wayback_elements)} wayback elements') "keyword">for element "keyword">in wayback_elements: element.decompose() # Remove script "keyword">and style tags "keyword">for cleaner text "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-content-ltr'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(f&#x27;Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, "name") "keyword">else "entire page"}') # Extract clean text page_text = main_content.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in page_text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) print(f&#x27;Extracted text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters') # Save the target webpage content target_filename = &#x27;target_webpage_content.html' target_text_filename = &#x27;target_webpage_text.txt' "keyword">with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_filename), &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Raw HTML saved to {target_filename}') "keyword">with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_text_filename), &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;TARGET WEBPAGE FROM CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source URL: {target_url}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Page Title: {page_title "keyword">if "page_title" "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else "Unknown"}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Access Date: {time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}\n') f.write(&#x27;='*80 + '\n\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Clean text saved to {target_text_filename}') # Show content preview print(f&#x27;\nTarget webpage content preview (first 500 characters):') print(&#x27;='*60) print(clean_text[:500] + &#x27;...') print(&#x27;='*60) # Analyze the page structure "keyword">and content print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING TARGET WEBPAGE ===') # Look "keyword">for key elements headings = main_content.find_all([&#x27;h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], limit=5) "keyword">if headings: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(headings)} headings:') "keyword">for i, heading "keyword">in enumerate(headings, 1): heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. <{heading.name}>: {heading_text}') # Look "keyword">for external links "keyword">in the target page all_links = main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) external_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in all_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">and &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">not "keyword">in href.lower()): external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(external_links)} external links "keyword">in target page:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(external_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') # Create comprehensive analysis target_analysis = { &#x27;citation_source': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;citation_number': citation_data.get('first_citation', {}).get('reference_number', 1), &#x27;citation_text': citation_data.get('first_citation', {}).get('reference_text', '[1]') }, &#x27;target_webpage': { &#x27;url': target_url, &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;status_code': response.status_code, &#x27;title': page_title "keyword">if 'page_title' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 'Unknown', &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;is_wikipedia_page': 'wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url, &#x27;is_archived_page': 'web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url }, &#x27;content_analysis': { &#x27;headings_found': len(headings) "keyword">if 'headings' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 0, &#x27;external_links_found': len(external_links), &#x27;text_length': len(clean_text) }, &#x27;external_links': external_links[:20], # Save first 20 external links &#x27;access_info': { &#x27;access_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;user_agent': headers['User-Agent'] } } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(target_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete target webpage analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') # Determine "keyword">if this completes our objective "keyword">if &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27;\nüìã ANALYSIS: First citation leads to another Wikipedia page') print(&#x27;This "keyword">is a cross-reference within Wikipedia rather than an external source') print(&#x27;The citation system "keyword">is working correctly - we\'ve successfully followed the first citation link') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nüìã ANALYSIS: First citation leads to external webpage') print(&#x27;Successfully accessed the external source referenced "keyword">in Carl Nebel\'s Wikipedia page') print(&#x27;\n*** TASK COMPLETED: First citation reference link successfully followed ***') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 404: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Target webpage "keyword">not found (404)') print(&#x27;The citation link may be broken "keyword">or the page may have been moved') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 403: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Access forbidden (403)') print(&#x27;The target website may be blocking automated requests') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Request failed "keyword">with status code: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response content preview: {response.text[:200]}...') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.Timeout: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Request timed out') print(&#x27;The target webpage took too long to respond') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Connection error') print(&#x27;Could "keyword">not establish connection to the target webpage') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Error accessing target webpage: {str(e)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No valid citation link found "keyword">in the extracted data') print(&#x27;Cannot proceed to access target webpage') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Follow first citation link "keyword">from Carl Nebel Wikipedia page to target webpage') print(&#x27;Status: Citation link accessed "keyword">and target webpage content analyzed') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in file "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;target', 'citation', 'analysis']): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:43:15

Execution failed - Code ran but exited early due to missing citation analysis files. The code was looking for JSON files with 'citation' in the filename, but found none in the workspace directory. Only 2 files are available: 'carl_nebel_wikipedia_august_2023.html' (100KB) and 'carl_nebel_clean_text.txt' (5.6KB). Next step: Re-run the citation extraction process to generate the required JSON file with citation link data, then proceed with following the first citation link to the target webpage.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import time print(&#x27;=== FOLLOWING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK FROM CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Access the first citation link "keyword">and examine the target webpage') print(&#x27;Status: Citation link extraction completed, now following the link') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # First, let's inspect the extracted citation data workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Look "keyword">for the citation analysis file citation_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;citation' "keyword">in f "keyword">and f.endswith('.json')] print(f&#x27;\nAvailable citation files: {citation_files}') "keyword">if citation_files: citation_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, citation_files[-1]) # Use most recent print(f&#x27;Loading citation data "keyword">from: {os.path.basename(citation_file)}') # First inspect the file structure "keyword">with open(citation_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: citation_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;\n=== INSPECTING CITATION DATA STRUCTURE ===') print(&#x27;Available keys "keyword">in citation data:') "keyword">for key "keyword">in citation_data.keys(): print(f&#x27; - {key}: {type(citation_data[key])}') # Display the key information "keyword">if &#x27;first_citation_link' "keyword">in citation_data: link_info = citation_data[&#x27;first_citation_link'] print(f&#x27;\nFirst citation link details:') print(f&#x27; URL: {link_info.get("url", "Not found")}') print(f&#x27; Link text: "{link_info.get("link_text", "Not found")}"') print(f&#x27; HTML tag: {link_info.get("full_html_tag", "Not found")}') # Check "keyword">if we have source info "keyword">if &#x27;source_info' "keyword">in citation_data: source_info = citation_data[&#x27;source_info'] print(f&#x27;\nSource information:') print(f&#x27; Wikipedia page: {source_info.get("wikipedia_page", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Archive date: {source_info.get("archive_date", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Archive URL: {source_info.get("archive_url", "Unknown")}') # Display reference item text "keyword">if &#x27;reference_item_full_text' "keyword">in citation_data: ref_text = citation_data[&#x27;reference_item_full_text'] print(f&#x27;\nFirst reference item text:') print(&#x27;='*60) print(ref_text) print(&#x27;='*60) "keyword">else: print(&#x27;‚ùå No citation analysis files found') # Let's check what files are available print(&#x27;\nAvailable files "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27; - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') exit() # Based on the tester feedback, the first citation was to Thieme-Becker via archive.org # Let's examine what we actually have "keyword">and handle accordingly "keyword">if &#x27;first_citation_link' "keyword">in citation_data "keyword">and citation_data['first_citation_link']['url']: target_url = citation_data[&#x27;first_citation_link']['url'] link_text = citation_data[&#x27;first_citation_link']['link_text'] print(f&#x27;\n=== FOLLOWING FIRST CITATION LINK ===') print(f&#x27;Target URL: {target_url}') print(f&#x27;Link text: "{link_text}"') # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is an archive.org URL pointing to another Wikipedia page "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url "keyword">and 'wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† Note: This "keyword">is an archived Wikipedia page (internal reference)') print(&#x27;This suggests the first citation "keyword">is a cross-reference to another Wikipedia article') print(&#x27;\n=== ACCESSING TARGET WEBPAGE ===') # Set up headers "keyword">for the request headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Referer': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel' } "keyword">try: print(f&#x27;Requesting: {target_url}') response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content-Type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f&#x27;Final URL: {response.url}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(&#x27;\n‚úì Successfully accessed target webpage') # Parse the content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find(&#x27;title') "keyword">if title: page_title = title.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Remove wayback machine elements "keyword">if present wayback_elements = soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()) print(f&#x27;Removing {len(wayback_elements)} wayback elements') "keyword">for element "keyword">in wayback_elements: element.decompose() # Remove script "keyword">and style tags "keyword">for cleaner text "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-content-ltr'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(f&#x27;Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, "name") "keyword">else "entire page"}') # Extract clean text page_text = main_content.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in page_text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) print(f&#x27;Extracted text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters') # Save the target webpage content target_filename = &#x27;target_webpage_content.html' target_text_filename = &#x27;target_webpage_text.txt' "keyword">with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_filename), &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Raw HTML saved to {target_filename}') "keyword">with open(os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_text_filename), &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;TARGET WEBPAGE FROM CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source URL: {target_url}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Page Title: {page_title "keyword">if "page_title" "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else "Unknown"}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Access Date: {time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}\n') f.write(&#x27;='*80 + '\n\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Clean text saved to {target_text_filename}') # Show content preview print(f&#x27;\nTarget webpage content preview (first 500 characters):') print(&#x27;='*60) print(clean_text[:500] + &#x27;...') print(&#x27;='*60) # Analyze the page structure "keyword">and content print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING TARGET WEBPAGE ===') # Look "keyword">for key elements headings = main_content.find_all([&#x27;h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], limit=5) "keyword">if headings: print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(headings)} headings:') "keyword">for i, heading "keyword">in enumerate(headings, 1): heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. <{heading.name}>: {heading_text}') # Look "keyword">for external links "keyword">in the target page all_links = main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) external_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in all_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">and &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">not "keyword">in href.lower()): external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(external_links)} external links "keyword">in target page:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(external_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') # Create comprehensive analysis target_analysis = { &#x27;citation_source': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;citation_number': citation_data.get('first_citation', {}).get('reference_number', 1), &#x27;citation_text': citation_data.get('first_citation', {}).get('reference_text', '[1]') }, &#x27;target_webpage': { &#x27;url': target_url, &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;status_code': response.status_code, &#x27;title': page_title "keyword">if 'page_title' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 'Unknown', &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;is_wikipedia_page': 'wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url, &#x27;is_archived_page': 'web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url }, &#x27;content_analysis': { &#x27;headings_found': len(headings) "keyword">if 'headings' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 0, &#x27;external_links_found': len(external_links), &#x27;text_length': len(clean_text) }, &#x27;external_links': external_links[:20], # Save first 20 external links &#x27;access_info': { &#x27;access_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;user_agent': headers['User-Agent'] } } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(target_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete target webpage analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') # Determine "keyword">if this completes our objective "keyword">if &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27;\nüìã ANALYSIS: First citation leads to another Wikipedia page') print(&#x27;This "keyword">is a cross-reference within Wikipedia rather than an external source') print(&#x27;The citation system "keyword">is working correctly - we\'ve successfully followed the first citation link') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\nüìã ANALYSIS: First citation leads to external webpage') print(&#x27;Successfully accessed the external source referenced "keyword">in Carl Nebel\'s Wikipedia page') print(&#x27;\n*** TASK COMPLETED: First citation reference link successfully followed ***') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 404: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Target webpage "keyword">not found (404)') print(&#x27;The citation link may be broken "keyword">or the page may have been moved') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 403: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Access forbidden (403)') print(&#x27;The target website may be blocking automated requests') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Request failed "keyword">with status code: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response content preview: {response.text[:200]}...') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.Timeout: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Request timed out') print(&#x27;The target webpage took too long to respond') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Connection error') print(&#x27;Could "keyword">not establish connection to the target webpage') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Error accessing target webpage: {str(e)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No valid citation link found "keyword">in the extracted data') print(&#x27;Cannot proceed to access target webpage') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Follow first citation link "keyword">from Carl Nebel Wikipedia page to target webpage') print(&#x27;Status: Citation link accessed "keyword">and target webpage content analyzed') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if any(keyword "keyword">in file "keyword">for keyword "keyword">in [&#x27;target', 'citation', 'analysis']): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output

developer Code Execution - Plan 01 (Iteration 5)
2025-08-11 06:44:37

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== RE-EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK FROM CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ===') print(&#x27;Issue: Citation analysis JSON file missing "keyword">from workspace') print(&#x27;Solution: Re-run citation extraction process to generate required data') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # Get workspace directory "keyword">and HTML file workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_wikipedia_august_2023.html') print(f&#x27;Loading HTML file: {os.path.basename(html_file)}') "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;‚úì HTML loaded "keyword">and parsed') # Remove wayback elements "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()): element.decompose() # Find main content main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(f&#x27;Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, "name") "keyword">else "entire page"}') # Find all citations citation_pattern = r&#x27;\[(\d+)\]' citations = re.finditer(citation_pattern, main_content.get_text()) citation_list = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in citations: citation_num = match.group(1) position = match.start() citation_list.append({ &#x27;number': int(citation_num), &#x27;text': match.group(0), &#x27;position': position }) citation_list.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;position']) print(f&#x27;Found {len(citation_list)} citations, first "keyword">is: {citation_list[0]["text"] "keyword">if citation_list "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}') "keyword">if "keyword">not citation_list: print(&#x27;‚ùå No citations found') exit() first_citation = citation_list[0] print(&#x27;\n=== FINDING REFERENCES SECTION AND EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK ===') # Find References heading references_heading = "keyword">None heading_selectors = [&#x27;#References', 'span#References'] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in heading_selectors: "keyword">try: elements = main_content.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: references_heading = elements[0] print(f&#x27;‚úì Found References heading using: {selector}') "keyword">break "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Selector {selector} failed: {str(e)}') "keyword">if references_heading: # Get the parent element (h2 containing References) heading_parent = references_heading.parent print(f&#x27;References heading parent: <{heading_parent.name "keyword">if heading_parent "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}>') # Find the following <ol> element containing reference items references_section = "keyword">None current = heading_parent "keyword">while current "keyword">and current.next_sibling: current = current.next_sibling "keyword">if hasattr(current, &#x27;name') "keyword">and current.name == 'ol': references_section = current print(f&#x27;‚úì Found references <ol> element after heading') "keyword">break "keyword">elif hasattr(current, &#x27;find_all'): # Check "keyword">if this element contains <ol> elements nested_ols = current.find_all(&#x27;ol') "keyword">if nested_ols: references_section = nested_ols[0] print(f&#x27;‚úì Found references <ol> element nested "keyword">in following content') "keyword">break "keyword">if references_section: # Find all <li> elements "keyword">in the references section ref_items = references_section.find_all(&#x27;li') print(f&#x27;Found {len(ref_items)} reference items "keyword">in <ol> element') "keyword">if ref_items: # Use the first reference item target_ref_item = ref_items[0] print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING FIRST REFERENCE ITEM ===') ref_text = target_ref_item.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;First reference text: {ref_text}') # Find all links "keyword">in the first reference all_links = target_ref_item.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Found {len(all_links)} links "keyword">in first reference:') # Analyze each link valid_links = [] "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(all_links, 1): href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link_text}" -> {href}') # Check "keyword">if it's a valid reference link ("keyword">not just anchor links) "keyword">if href "keyword">and "keyword">not href.startswith(&#x27;#'): valid_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;full_tag': str(link) }) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Valid reference link identified') "keyword">if valid_links: first_link = valid_links[0] print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK FOUND:') print(f&#x27;Link text: "{first_link["text"]}"') print(f&#x27;URL: {first_link["url"]}') print(f&#x27;Full HTML tag: {first_link["full_tag"]}') # Save the citation analysis analysis_results = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;archive_date': '2023-03-06', &#x27;archive_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel', &#x27;extraction_method': 'References heading + following <ol> parsing', &#x27;extraction_timestamp': '2024-12-19' }, &#x27;first_citation': { &#x27;reference_number': first_citation['number'], &#x27;reference_text': first_citation['text'], &#x27;position_in_text': first_citation['position'] }, &#x27;first_citation_link': { &#x27;url': first_link['url'], &#x27;link_text': first_link['text'], &#x27;full_html_tag': first_link['full_tag'] }, &#x27;reference_item_full_text': ref_text, &#x27;metadata': { &#x27;total_citations_found': len(citation_list), &#x27;total_reference_items': len(ref_items), &#x27;total_links_in_first_ref': len(all_links), &#x27;total_valid_links_in_first_ref': len(valid_links) } } output_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_citation_link_extracted.json') "keyword">with open(output_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Citation analysis saved to {os.path.basename(output_file)}') # Now follow the link to the target webpage print(f&#x27;\n=== FOLLOWING CITATION LINK TO TARGET WEBPAGE ===') target_url = first_link[&#x27;url'] print(f&#x27;Target URL: {target_url}') # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is an archive.org URL "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27;‚ö† Note: This "keyword">is an archived webpage via Wayback Machine') "keyword">if &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27; This appears to be an archived Wikipedia page (internal reference)') # Set up headers "keyword">for the request headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Referer': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel' } "keyword">try: print(f&#x27;\nRequesting target webpage...') response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content-Type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f&#x27;Final URL: {response.url}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(&#x27;\n‚úì Successfully accessed target webpage') # Parse the content target_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title title = target_soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Remove wayback elements "keyword">if present wayback_elements = target_soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()) print(f&#x27;Removing {len(wayback_elements)} wayback elements "keyword">from target page') "keyword">for element "keyword">in wayback_elements: element.decompose() # Remove script "keyword">and style tags "keyword">for element "keyword">in target_soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Find main content target_main_content = target_soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not target_main_content: target_main_content = target_soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-content-ltr'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not target_main_content: target_main_content = target_soup # Extract clean text page_text = target_main_content.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in page_text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) print(f&#x27;Extracted text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters') # Save target webpage content target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') target_text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_text.txt') "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Raw HTML saved to {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') "keyword">with open(target_text_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;TARGET WEBPAGE FROM CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source Citation: {first_citation["text"]} "keyword">from Carl Nebel Wikipedia\n') f.write(f&#x27;Target URL: {target_url}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Page Title: {page_title}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Access Date: 2024-12-19\n') f.write(&#x27;='*80 + '\n\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Clean text saved to {os.path.basename(target_text_file)}') # Show content preview print(f&#x27;\nTarget webpage content preview (first 400 characters):') print(&#x27;='*60) print(clean_text[:400] + &#x27;...') print(&#x27;='*60) # Analyze page structure print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING TARGET WEBPAGE STRUCTURE ===') # Find headings headings = target_main_content.find_all([&#x27;h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], limit=5) "keyword">if headings: print(f&#x27;Found {len(headings)} main headings:') "keyword">for i, heading "keyword">in enumerate(headings, 1): heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. <{heading.name}>: {heading_text[:60]}...') # Find external links all_target_links = target_main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) external_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in all_target_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">and &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">not "keyword">in href.lower()): external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(external_links)} external links "keyword">in target page:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(external_links[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link["text"][:30]}..." -> {link["url"]}') # Create comprehensive target analysis target_analysis = { &#x27;citation_source': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;citation_number': first_citation['number'], &#x27;citation_text': first_citation['text'], &#x27;reference_text': ref_text }, &#x27;target_webpage': { &#x27;url': target_url, &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;status_code': response.status_code, &#x27;title': page_title, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;is_wikipedia_page': 'wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url, &#x27;is_archived_page': 'web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url }, &#x27;content_analysis': { &#x27;headings_found': len(headings) "keyword">if headings "keyword">else 0, &#x27;external_links_found': len(external_links), &#x27;text_length': len(clean_text) }, &#x27;external_links': external_links[:10], # Save first 10 &#x27;access_info': { &#x27;access_timestamp': '2024-12-19', &#x27;user_agent': headers['User-Agent'] } } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(target_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Target webpage analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print(f&#x27;\n*** SUCCESS: First citation reference link successfully followed "keyword">and analyzed ***') print(f&#x27;Citation [{first_citation["number"]}] "keyword">from Carl Nebel Wikipedia led to: {page_title}') print(f&#x27;Target webpage content extracted "keyword">and saved "keyword">for further analysis') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Failed to access target webpage: HTTP {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response preview: {response.text[:200]}...') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.Timeout: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Request timed out - target webpage took too long to respond') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Connection error - could "keyword">not reach target webpage') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Error accessing target webpage: {str(e)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No valid reference links found "keyword">in first citation') print(&#x27;The first reference may only contain anchor links "keyword">or no links at all') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No reference items found "keyword">in references section') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Could "keyword">not locate references <ol> element after References heading') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå References heading "keyword">not found') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Extract first citation link "keyword">and follow it to target webpage') print(&#x27;Status: Complete citation extraction "keyword">and target webpage analysis') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === RE-EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK FROM CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA === Issue: Citation analysis JSON file missing from workspace Solution: Re-run citation extraction process to generate required data ================================================================================ Loading HTML file: carl_nebel_wikipedia_august_2023.html ‚úì HTML loaded and parsed Main content area identified: div Found 9 citations, first is: [1] === FINDING REFERENCES SECTION AND EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK === ‚úì Found References heading using: #References References heading parent: <h2> ‚úì Found references <ol> element nested in following content Found 8 reference items in <ol> element === ANALYZING FIRST REFERENCE ITEM === First reference text: ^ a b Thieme-Becker, entry "Nebel, Carl" Found 3 links in first reference: 1. "a" -> #cite_ref-thb_1-0 2. "b" -> #cite_ref-thb_1-1 3. "Thieme-Becker" -> http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker ‚úì Valid reference link identified üéØ FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK FOUND: Link text: "Thieme-Becker" URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker Full HTML tag: <a class="extiw" href="http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker" title="de:Thieme-Becker">Thieme-Becker</a> ‚úì Citation analysis saved to carl_nebel_citation_link_extracted.json === FOLLOWING CITATION LINK TO TARGET WEBPAGE === Target URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker ‚ö† Note: This is an archived webpage via Wayback Machine This appears to be an archived Wikipedia page (internal reference) Requesting target webpage... Response status: 200 Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Content length: 181,555 bytes Final URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230307222308/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker ‚úì Successfully accessed target webpage Page title: "Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia" Removing 0 wayback elements from target page Extracted text length: 39,037 characters ‚úì Raw HTML saved to target_webpage_content.html ‚úì Clean text saved to target_webpage_text.txt Target webpage content preview (first 400 characters): ============================================================ Seite aus dem Thieme-Becker. Band 26, S. 460 Thieme-Becker (seltener ThB) ist die allgemein gebr√§uchliche Abk√ºrzung f√ºr das von Ulrich Thieme und Felix Becker begr√ºndete und sp√§ter von Hans Vollmer fortgesetzte vielb√§ndige K√ºnstlerlexikon mit dem vollst√§ndigen Titel: Allgemeines Lexikon der Bildenden K√ºnstler von der Antike bis zur Gegenwart. Es wurde in den 1950er Jahren erg√§nzt von Hans Vollmers... ============================================================ === ANALYZING TARGET WEBPAGE STRUCTURE === Found 5 main headings: 1. <h2>: Inhaltsverzeichnis... 2. <h2>: Thieme-Becker[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeiten]... 3. <h3>: Bedeutung[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeiten]... 4. <h3>: Vorl√§ufer[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeiten]... 5. <h3>: Geschichte des Thieme-Becker[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeit... Found 0 external links in target page: ‚úì Target webpage analysis saved to target_webpage_analysis.json *** SUCCESS: First citation reference link successfully followed and analyzed *** Citation [1] from Carl Nebel Wikipedia led to: Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia Target webpage content extracted and saved for further analysis ================================================================================ CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS COMPLETE ================================================================================ Objective: Extract first citation link and follow it to target webpage Status: Complete citation extraction and target webpage analysis Files created in workspace: - carl_nebel_citation_link_extracted.json (1,009 bytes) - carl_nebel_clean_text.txt (5,648 bytes) - carl_nebel_wikipedia_august_2023.html (100,144 bytes) - target_webpage_analysis.json (909 bytes) - target_webpage_content.html (181,555 bytes) - target_webpage_text.txt (40,570 bytes)
tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:44:37

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully completed the **PLAN** objectives. The script re-extracted the first citation link from Carl Nebel's Wikipedia page, found it points to 'Thieme-Becker' (http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker), then successfully followed that link to access the target webpage. The code properly identified this as an archived German Wikipedia page about the Thieme-Becker art lexicon, extracted 39,037 characters of clean text, and analyzed the page structure (found 5 headings, 0 external links). All required files were created: 'carl_nebel_citation_link_extracted.json' (1,009 bytes), 'target_webpage_content.html' (181,555 bytes), 'target_webpage_text.txt' (40,570 bytes), and 'target_webpage_analysis.json' (909 bytes). **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete - the first citation reference link was successfully extracted, accessed, and the target webpage content was thoroughly analyzed and documented. No further development is needed as the task has been fully accomplished.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== RE-EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK FROM CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ===') print(&#x27;Issue: Citation analysis JSON file missing "keyword">from workspace') print(&#x27;Solution: Re-run citation extraction process to generate required data') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # Get workspace directory "keyword">and HTML file workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_wikipedia_august_2023.html') print(f&#x27;Loading HTML file: {os.path.basename(html_file)}') "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;‚úì HTML loaded "keyword">and parsed') # Remove wayback elements "keyword">for element "keyword">in soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()): element.decompose() # Find main content main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(f&#x27;Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, "name") "keyword">else "entire page"}') # Find all citations citation_pattern = r&#x27;\[(\d+)\]' citations = re.finditer(citation_pattern, main_content.get_text()) citation_list = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in citations: citation_num = match.group(1) position = match.start() citation_list.append({ &#x27;number': int(citation_num), &#x27;text': match.group(0), &#x27;position': position }) citation_list.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: x[&#x27;position']) print(f&#x27;Found {len(citation_list)} citations, first "keyword">is: {citation_list[0]["text"] "keyword">if citation_list "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}') "keyword">if "keyword">not citation_list: print(&#x27;‚ùå No citations found') exit() first_citation = citation_list[0] print(&#x27;\n=== FINDING REFERENCES SECTION AND EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK ===') # Find References heading references_heading = "keyword">None heading_selectors = [&#x27;#References', 'span#References'] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in heading_selectors: "keyword">try: elements = main_content.select(selector) "keyword">if elements: references_heading = elements[0] print(f&#x27;‚úì Found References heading using: {selector}') "keyword">break "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Selector {selector} failed: {str(e)}') "keyword">if references_heading: # Get the parent element (h2 containing References) heading_parent = references_heading.parent print(f&#x27;References heading parent: <{heading_parent.name "keyword">if heading_parent "keyword">else ""keyword">None"}>') # Find the following <ol> element containing reference items references_section = "keyword">None current = heading_parent "keyword">while current "keyword">and current.next_sibling: current = current.next_sibling "keyword">if hasattr(current, &#x27;name') "keyword">and current.name == 'ol': references_section = current print(f&#x27;‚úì Found references <ol> element after heading') "keyword">break "keyword">elif hasattr(current, &#x27;find_all'): # Check "keyword">if this element contains <ol> elements nested_ols = current.find_all(&#x27;ol') "keyword">if nested_ols: references_section = nested_ols[0] print(f&#x27;‚úì Found references <ol> element nested "keyword">in following content') "keyword">break "keyword">if references_section: # Find all <li> elements "keyword">in the references section ref_items = references_section.find_all(&#x27;li') print(f&#x27;Found {len(ref_items)} reference items "keyword">in <ol> element') "keyword">if ref_items: # Use the first reference item target_ref_item = ref_items[0] print(f&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING FIRST REFERENCE ITEM ===') ref_text = target_ref_item.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27;First reference text: {ref_text}') # Find all links "keyword">in the first reference all_links = target_ref_item.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Found {len(all_links)} links "keyword">in first reference:') # Analyze each link valid_links = [] "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(all_links, 1): href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link_text}" -> {href}') # Check "keyword">if it's a valid reference link ("keyword">not just anchor links) "keyword">if href "keyword">and "keyword">not href.startswith(&#x27;#'): valid_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;full_tag': str(link) }) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Valid reference link identified') "keyword">if valid_links: first_link = valid_links[0] print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK FOUND:') print(f&#x27;Link text: "{first_link["text"]}"') print(f&#x27;URL: {first_link["url"]}') print(f&#x27;Full HTML tag: {first_link["full_tag"]}') # Save the citation analysis analysis_results = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;archive_date': '2023-03-06', &#x27;archive_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel', &#x27;extraction_method': 'References heading + following <ol> parsing', &#x27;extraction_timestamp': '2024-12-19' }, &#x27;first_citation': { &#x27;reference_number': first_citation['number'], &#x27;reference_text': first_citation['text'], &#x27;position_in_text': first_citation['position'] }, &#x27;first_citation_link': { &#x27;url': first_link['url'], &#x27;link_text': first_link['text'], &#x27;full_html_tag': first_link['full_tag'] }, &#x27;reference_item_full_text': ref_text, &#x27;metadata': { &#x27;total_citations_found': len(citation_list), &#x27;total_reference_items': len(ref_items), &#x27;total_links_in_first_ref': len(all_links), &#x27;total_valid_links_in_first_ref': len(valid_links) } } output_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_citation_link_extracted.json') "keyword">with open(output_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Citation analysis saved to {os.path.basename(output_file)}') # Now follow the link to the target webpage print(f&#x27;\n=== FOLLOWING CITATION LINK TO TARGET WEBPAGE ===') target_url = first_link[&#x27;url'] print(f&#x27;Target URL: {target_url}') # Check "keyword">if this "keyword">is an archive.org URL "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27;‚ö† Note: This "keyword">is an archived webpage via Wayback Machine') "keyword">if &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url: print(&#x27; This appears to be an archived Wikipedia page (internal reference)') # Set up headers "keyword">for the request headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Referer': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel' } "keyword">try: print(f&#x27;\nRequesting target webpage...') response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content-Type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') print(f&#x27;Final URL: {response.url}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(&#x27;\n‚úì Successfully accessed target webpage') # Parse the content target_soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title title = target_soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Remove wayback elements "keyword">if present wayback_elements = target_soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()) print(f&#x27;Removing {len(wayback_elements)} wayback elements "keyword">from target page') "keyword">for element "keyword">in wayback_elements: element.decompose() # Remove script "keyword">and style tags "keyword">for element "keyword">in target_soup([&#x27;script', 'style']): element.decompose() # Find main content target_main_content = target_soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not target_main_content: target_main_content = target_soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-content-ltr'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not target_main_content: target_main_content = target_soup # Extract clean text page_text = target_main_content.get_text() lines = (line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in page_text.splitlines()) chunks = (phrase.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines "keyword">for phrase "keyword">in line.split(" ")) clean_text = &#x27; '.join(chunk "keyword">for chunk "keyword">in chunks "keyword">if chunk) print(f&#x27;Extracted text length: {len(clean_text):,} characters') # Save target webpage content target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') target_text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_text.txt') "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Raw HTML saved to {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') "keyword">with open(target_text_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;TARGET WEBPAGE FROM CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source Citation: {first_citation["text"]} "keyword">from Carl Nebel Wikipedia\n') f.write(f&#x27;Target URL: {target_url}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Page Title: {page_title}\n') f.write(f&#x27;Access Date: 2024-12-19\n') f.write(&#x27;='*80 + '\n\n') f.write(clean_text) print(f&#x27;‚úì Clean text saved to {os.path.basename(target_text_file)}') # Show content preview print(f&#x27;\nTarget webpage content preview (first 400 characters):') print(&#x27;='*60) print(clean_text[:400] + &#x27;...') print(&#x27;='*60) # Analyze page structure print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING TARGET WEBPAGE STRUCTURE ===') # Find headings headings = target_main_content.find_all([&#x27;h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], limit=5) "keyword">if headings: print(f&#x27;Found {len(headings)} main headings:') "keyword">for i, heading "keyword">in enumerate(headings, 1): heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() print(f&#x27; {i}. <{heading.name}>: {heading_text[:60]}...') # Find external links all_target_links = target_main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) external_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in all_target_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href', '') "keyword">if (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">and &#x27;wikipedia.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">not "keyword">in href.lower()): external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link.get_text().strip() }) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(external_links)} external links "keyword">in target page:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(external_links[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f&#x27; {i}. "{link["text"][:30]}..." -> {link["url"]}') # Create comprehensive target analysis target_analysis = { &#x27;citation_source': { &#x27;wikipedia_page': 'Carl Nebel', &#x27;citation_number': first_citation['number'], &#x27;citation_text': first_citation['text'], &#x27;reference_text': ref_text }, &#x27;target_webpage': { &#x27;url': target_url, &#x27;final_url': response.url, &#x27;status_code': response.status_code, &#x27;title': page_title, &#x27;content_length': len(clean_text), &#x27;is_wikipedia_page': 'wikipedia.org' "keyword">in target_url, &#x27;is_archived_page': 'web.archive.org' "keyword">in target_url }, &#x27;content_analysis': { &#x27;headings_found': len(headings) "keyword">if headings "keyword">else 0, &#x27;external_links_found': len(external_links), &#x27;text_length': len(clean_text) }, &#x27;external_links': external_links[:10], # Save first 10 &#x27;access_info': { &#x27;access_timestamp': '2024-12-19', &#x27;user_agent': headers['User-Agent'] } } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(target_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Target webpage analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print(f&#x27;\n*** SUCCESS: First citation reference link successfully followed "keyword">and analyzed ***') print(f&#x27;Citation [{first_citation["number"]}] "keyword">from Carl Nebel Wikipedia led to: {page_title}') print(f&#x27;Target webpage content extracted "keyword">and saved "keyword">for further analysis') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Failed to access target webpage: HTTP {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Response preview: {response.text[:200]}...') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.Timeout: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Request timed out - target webpage took too long to respond') "keyword">except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Connection error - could "keyword">not reach target webpage') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;\n‚ùå Error accessing target webpage: {str(e)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No valid reference links found "keyword">in first citation') print(&#x27;The first reference may only contain anchor links "keyword">or no links at all') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No reference items found "keyword">in references section') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå Could "keyword">not locate references <ol> element after References heading') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå References heading "keyword">not found') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;CARL NEBEL FIRST CITATION EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Extract first citation link "keyword">and follow it to target webpage') print(&#x27;Status: Complete citation extraction "keyword">and target webpage analysis') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === RE-EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK FROM CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA === Issue: Citation analysis JSON file missing from workspace Solution: Re-run citation extraction process to generate required data ================================================================================ Loading HTML file: carl_nebel_wikipedia_august_2023.html ‚úì HTML loaded and parsed Main content area identified: div Found 9 citations, first is: [1] === FINDING REFERENCES SECTION AND EXTRACTING FIRST CITATION LINK === ‚úì Found References heading using: #References References heading parent: <h2> ‚úì Found references <ol> element nested in following content Found 8 reference items in <ol> element === ANALYZING FIRST REFERENCE ITEM === First reference text: ^ a b Thieme-Becker, entry "Nebel, Carl" Found 3 links in first reference: 1. "a" -> #cite_ref-thb_1-0 2. "b" -> #cite_ref-thb_1-1 3. Es wurde in den 1950er Jahren erg√§nzt von Hans Vollmers... ============================================================ === ANALYZING TARGET WEBPAGE STRUCTURE === Found 5 main headings: 1. <h2>: Inhaltsverzeichnis... 2. <h2>: Thieme-Becker[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeiten]... 3. <h3>: Bedeutung[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeiten]... 4. <h3>: Vorl√§ufer[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeiten]... 5. <h3>: Geschichte des Thieme-Becker[Bearbeiten | Quelltext bearbeit...
