"keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Check "keyword">for existing target webpage files target_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;target_webpage' "keyword">in f] print(f&#x27;\nExisting target webpage files: {target_files}') # Load the target webpage HTML "keyword">if available, otherwise access it directly target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') target_url = &#x27;http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker' "keyword">if os.path.exists(target_html_file): print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Loading existing target webpage HTML: {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') file_size = os.path.getsize(target_html_file) print(f&#x27;File size: {file_size:,} bytes') "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(&#x27;‚úì Target webpage HTML loaded "keyword">from file') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Target webpage HTML "keyword">not found, accessing directly: {target_url}') headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: html_content = response.text print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Save "keyword">for future reference "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(html_content) print(f&#x27;‚úì Target webpage HTML saved to {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Failed to access target webpage: HTTP {response.status_code}') exit() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing target webpage: {str(e)}') exit() # Parse the HTML content print(&#x27;\n=== PARSING TARGET WEBPAGE FOR IMAGES ===') soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;‚úì HTML parsed successfully') # Get page title "keyword">for context title = soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Remove wayback machine elements "keyword">for cleaner analysis wayback_elements = soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()) print(f&#x27;Removing {len(wayback_elements)} wayback elements') "keyword">for element "keyword">in wayback_elements: element.decompose() # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-content-ltr'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(f&#x27;Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, "name") "keyword">else "entire page"}') print(&#x27;\n=== SYSTEMATIC IMAGE SEARCH ===') # Find all image elements img_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f&#x27;Found {len(img_elements)} <img> elements "keyword">in main content') # Also look "keyword">for figure elements which might contain images figure_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;figure') print(f&#x27;Found {len(figure_elements)} <figure> elements') # Look "keyword">for any elements "keyword">with image-related classes image_containers = main_content.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and any(term "keyword">in str(x).lower() "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;image', 'thumb', 'picture', 'photo', 'illustration'])) print(f&#x27;Found {len(image_containers)} elements "keyword">with image-related classes') # Collect all unique images all_images = [] image_sources = set() # To avoid duplicates # Process <img> elements "keyword">for img "keyword">in img_elements: src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') title_attr = img.get(&#x27;title', '') "keyword">if src "keyword">and src "keyword">not "keyword">in image_sources: image_sources.add(src) # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): src = &#x27;https:' + src "keyword">elif src.startswith(&#x27;/'): src = urljoin(target_url, src) all_images.append({ &#x27;type': 'img_element', &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': alt, &#x27;title': title_attr, &#x27;element': str(img)[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(str(img)) > 200 "keyword">else str(img) }) # Process figure elements "keyword">for additional images "keyword">for figure "keyword">in figure_elements: figure_imgs = figure.find_all(&#x27;img') "keyword">for img "keyword">in figure_imgs: src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">if src "keyword">and src "keyword">not "keyword">in image_sources: image_sources.add(src) "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): src = &#x27;https:' + src "keyword">elif src.startswith(&#x27;/'): src = urljoin(target_url, src) all_images.append({ &#x27;type': 'figure_img', &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;element': str(img)[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(str(img)) > 200 "keyword">else str(img) }) print(f&#x27;\nüìä TOTAL UNIQUE IMAGES FOUND: {len(all_images)}') "keyword">if len(all_images) == 0: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No images found on the target webpage') print(&#x27;This might indicate:') print(&#x27; - The page has no embedded images') print(&#x27; - Images are loaded via JavaScript ("keyword">not accessible "keyword">in static HTML)') print(&#x27; - Images are "keyword">in a different content area') # Let's check the entire page "keyword">for any image references print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING ENTIRE PAGE FOR IMAGE REFERENCES ===') all_page_imgs = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f&#x27;Found {len(all_page_imgs)} <img> elements "keyword">in entire page') "keyword">if all_page_imgs: print(&#x27;All page images:') "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_page_imgs[:5], 1): # Show first 5 src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') print(f&#x27; {i}. src="{src[:60]}..." alt="{alt[:40]}..."') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING IMAGES FOR CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR DATES ===') # Display all found images print(&#x27;\nAll images found on the page:') "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. {img_info["type"]}:') print(f&#x27; Source: {img_info["src"]}') print(f&#x27; Alt text: "{img_info["alt"]}"') print(f&#x27; Title: "{img_info["title"]}"') print(f&#x27; Element: {img_info["element"]}') # Now let's analyze each image "keyword">for year dates print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR YEAR DATES IN IMAGE METADATA ===') years_found = [] # Check image alt text, titles, "keyword">and surrounding context "keyword">for year dates year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(1[0-9]{3}|20[0-9]{2})\b' # Matches years "keyword">from 1000-2099 "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing image {i}:') # Check alt text "keyword">for years alt_years = re.findall(year_pattern, img_info[&#x27;alt']) "keyword">if alt_years: print(f&#x27; Years "keyword">in alt text: {alt_years}') years_found.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in alt_years]) # Check title attribute "keyword">for years title_years = re.findall(year_pattern, img_info[&#x27;title']) "keyword">if title_years: print(f&#x27; Years "keyword">in title: {title_years}') years_found.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in title_years]) # Check surrounding context (captions, nearby text) # Find the original img element "keyword">in the soup to get surrounding context "keyword">for original_img "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;img'): "keyword">if original_img.get(&#x27;src', '') == img_info['src'].split('/')[-1] "keyword">or img_info['src'].endswith(original_img.get('src', '')): # Get parent element "keyword">and surrounding text parent = original_img.parent "keyword">if parent: parent_text = parent.get_text() context_years = re.findall(year_pattern, parent_text) "keyword">if context_years: print(f&#x27; Years "keyword">in surrounding context: {context_years}') years_found.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in context_years]) "keyword">break # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort years unique_years = sorted(list(set(years_found))) print(f&#x27;\nüìÖ CHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND IN IMAGES: {unique_years}') "keyword">if unique_years: latest_year = max(unique_years) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}') # Create detailed analysis image_analysis = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;target_webpage': target_url, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;total_images_found': len(all_images) }, &#x27;images_analyzed': all_images, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;all_years_found': unique_years, &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;total_unique_years': len(unique_years), &#x27;year_sources': { &#x27;alt_text': 'Years found "keyword">in image alt attributes', &#x27;title_attributes': 'Years found "keyword">in image title attributes', &#x27;surrounding_context': 'Years found "keyword">in text surrounding images' } }, &#x27;search_methodology': { &#x27;image_elements_searched': ['img', 'figure'], &#x27;year_pattern_used': year_pattern, &#x27;content_areas_analyzed': ['alt_text', 'title_attributes', 'surrounding_context'] } } # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_image_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(image_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete image analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print(f&#x27;\n*** TASK COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY ***') print(f&#x27;Target webpage: Thieme-Becker German Wikipedia page') print(f&#x27;Images analyzed: {len(all_images)}') print(f&#x27;Chronological years found: {unique_years}') print(f&#x27;Latest year identified: {latest_year}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chronological year dates found "keyword">in any image metadata "keyword">or surrounding context') print(&#x27;This could mean:') print(&#x27; - Images do "keyword">not contain chronological information "keyword">in their metadata') print(&#x27; - Year dates are embedded within the image content itself ("keyword">not accessible via HTML)') print(&#x27; - The page images are purely decorative without chronological significance') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Search target webpage images "keyword">for chronological year dates') print(&#x27;Method: Systematic analysis of all image elements "keyword">and metadata') print(&#x27;\nFiles created/updated "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:46:19

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements. The script successfully accessed the target webpage (Thieme-Becker German Wikipedia page) and found 3 images embedded on the page. However, the systematic search for chronological year dates within the images yielded no results - no years were found in image alt text, title attributes, or surrounding context. The code performed comprehensive analysis including multiple parsing approaches (img elements, figure elements, image-related classes) and searched various metadata sources, but found that the 3 images on the page appear to be decorative (Wikisource logo, tracking pixel) rather than containing chronological information. **PLAN** alignment: 90% complete - target webpage accessed, images identified and analyzed systematically, but no chronological year dates were discovered in the image metadata or surrounding context. The analysis was thorough and the methodology sound. The task completion depends on whether chronological dates exist in the actual image content (not accessible via HTML) or if this particular page simply doesn't contain images with embedded chronological information. The comprehensive analysis has been documented for reference.

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin print(&#x27;=== ACCESSING THIEME-BECKER WEBPAGE TO SEARCH FOR IMAGES WITH CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Access target webpage "keyword">and systematically search "keyword">for images "keyword">with year dates') print(&#x27;Target: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # First, let's check "keyword">if we have the target webpage data "keyword">from previous work workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Check "keyword">for existing target webpage files target_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;target_webpage' "keyword">in f] print(f&#x27;\nExisting target webpage files: {target_files}') # Load the target webpage HTML "keyword">if available, otherwise access it directly target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') target_url = &#x27;http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker' "keyword">if os.path.exists(target_html_file): print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Loading existing target webpage HTML: {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') file_size = os.path.getsize(target_html_file) print(f&#x27;File size: {file_size:,} bytes') "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(&#x27;‚úì Target webpage HTML loaded "keyword">from file') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Target webpage HTML "keyword">not found, accessing directly: {target_url}') headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5' } "keyword">try: response = requests.get(target_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Response status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: html_content = response.text print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Save "keyword">for future reference "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(html_content) print(f&#x27;‚úì Target webpage HTML saved to {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Failed to access target webpage: HTTP {response.status_code}') exit() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing target webpage: {str(e)}') exit() # Parse the HTML content print(&#x27;\n=== PARSING TARGET WEBPAGE FOR IMAGES ===') soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;‚úì HTML parsed successfully') # Get page title "keyword">for context title = soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Remove wayback machine elements "keyword">for cleaner analysis wayback_elements = soup.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;wayback' "keyword">in str(x).lower()) print(f&#x27;Removing {len(wayback_elements)} wayback elements') "keyword">for element "keyword">in wayback_elements: element.decompose() # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-content-ltr'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(f&#x27;Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, "name") "keyword">else "entire page"}') print(&#x27;\n=== SYSTEMATIC IMAGE SEARCH ===') # Find all image elements img_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f&#x27;Found {len(img_elements)} <img> elements "keyword">in main content') # Also look "keyword">for figure elements which might contain images figure_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;figure') print(f&#x27;Found {len(figure_elements)} <figure> elements') # Look "keyword">for any elements "keyword">with image-related classes image_containers = main_content.find_all(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and any(term "keyword">in str(x).lower() "keyword">for term "keyword">in [&#x27;image', 'thumb', 'picture', 'photo', 'illustration'])) print(f&#x27;Found {len(image_containers)} elements "keyword">with image-related classes') # Collect all unique images all_images = [] image_sources = set() # To avoid duplicates # Process <img> elements "keyword">for img "keyword">in img_elements: src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') title_attr = img.get(&#x27;title', '') "keyword">if src "keyword">and src "keyword">not "keyword">in image_sources: image_sources.add(src) # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): src = &#x27;https:' + src "keyword">elif src.startswith(&#x27;/'): src = urljoin(target_url, src) all_images.append({ &#x27;type': 'img_element', &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': alt, &#x27;title': title_attr, &#x27;element': str(img)[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(str(img)) > 200 "keyword">else str(img) }) # Process figure elements "keyword">for additional images "keyword">for figure "keyword">in figure_elements: figure_imgs = figure.find_all(&#x27;img') "keyword">for img "keyword">in figure_imgs: src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">if src "keyword">and src "keyword">not "keyword">in image_sources: image_sources.add(src) "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): src = &#x27;https:' + src "keyword">elif src.startswith(&#x27;/'): src = urljoin(target_url, src) all_images.append({ &#x27;type': 'figure_img', &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;element': str(img)[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(str(img)) > 200 "keyword">else str(img) }) print(f&#x27;\nüìä TOTAL UNIQUE IMAGES FOUND: {len(all_images)}') "keyword">if len(all_images) == 0: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No images found on the target webpage') print(&#x27;This might indicate:') print(&#x27; - The page has no embedded images') print(&#x27; - Images are loaded via JavaScript ("keyword">not accessible "keyword">in static HTML)') print(&#x27; - Images are "keyword">in a different content area') # Let's check the entire page "keyword">for any image references print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING ENTIRE PAGE FOR IMAGE REFERENCES ===') all_page_imgs = soup.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f&#x27;Found {len(all_page_imgs)} <img> elements "keyword">in entire page') "keyword">if all_page_imgs: print(&#x27;All page images:') "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_page_imgs[:5], 1): # Show first 5 src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') print(f&#x27; {i}. src="{src[:60]}..." alt="{alt[:40]}..."') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING IMAGES FOR CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR DATES ===') # Display all found images print(&#x27;\nAll images found on the page:') "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. {img_info["type"]}:') print(f&#x27; Source: {img_info["src"]}') print(f&#x27; Alt text: "{img_info["alt"]}"') print(f&#x27; Title: "{img_info["title"]}"') print(f&#x27; Element: {img_info["element"]}') # Now let's analyze each image "keyword">for year dates print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR YEAR DATES IN IMAGE METADATA ===') years_found = [] # Check image alt text, titles, "keyword">and surrounding context "keyword">for year dates year_pattern = r&#x27;\b(1[0-9]{3}|20[0-9]{2})\b' # Matches years "keyword">from 1000-2099 "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing image {i}:') # Check alt text "keyword">for years alt_years = re.findall(year_pattern, img_info[&#x27;alt']) "keyword">if alt_years: print(f&#x27; Years "keyword">in alt text: {alt_years}') years_found.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in alt_years]) # Check title attribute "keyword">for years title_years = re.findall(year_pattern, img_info[&#x27;title']) "keyword">if title_years: print(f&#x27; Years "keyword">in title: {title_years}') years_found.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in title_years]) # Check surrounding context (captions, nearby text) # Find the original img element "keyword">in the soup to get surrounding context "keyword">for original_img "keyword">in soup.find_all(&#x27;img'): "keyword">if original_img.get(&#x27;src', '') == img_info['src'].split('/')[-1] "keyword">or img_info['src'].endswith(original_img.get('src', '')): # Get parent element "keyword">and surrounding text parent = original_img.parent "keyword">if parent: parent_text = parent.get_text() context_years = re.findall(year_pattern, parent_text) "keyword">if context_years: print(f&#x27; Years "keyword">in surrounding context: {context_years}') years_found.extend([int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in context_years]) "keyword">break # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort years unique_years = sorted(list(set(years_found))) print(f&#x27;\nüìÖ CHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND IN IMAGES: {unique_years}') "keyword">if unique_years: latest_year = max(unique_years) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}') # Create detailed analysis image_analysis = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;target_webpage': target_url, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;total_images_found': len(all_images) }, &#x27;images_analyzed': all_images, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;all_years_found': unique_years, &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;total_unique_years': len(unique_years), &#x27;year_sources': { &#x27;alt_text': 'Years found "keyword">in image alt attributes', &#x27;title_attributes': 'Years found "keyword">in image title attributes', &#x27;surrounding_context': 'Years found "keyword">in text surrounding images' } }, &#x27;search_methodology': { &#x27;image_elements_searched': ['img', 'figure'], &#x27;year_pattern_used': year_pattern, &#x27;content_areas_analyzed': ['alt_text', 'title_attributes', 'surrounding_context'] } } # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_image_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(image_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete image analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print(f&#x27;\n*** TASK COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY ***') print(f&#x27;Target webpage: Thieme-Becker German Wikipedia page') print(f&#x27;Images analyzed: {len(all_images)}') print(f&#x27;Chronological years found: {unique_years}') print(f&#x27;Latest year identified: {latest_year}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chronological year dates found "keyword">in any image metadata "keyword">or surrounding context') print(&#x27;This could mean:') print(&#x27; - Images do "keyword">not contain chronological information "keyword">in their metadata') print(&#x27; - Year dates are embedded within the image content itself ("keyword">not accessible via HTML)') print(&#x27; - The page images are purely decorative without chronological significance') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Search target webpage images "keyword">for chronological year dates') print(&#x27;Method: Systematic analysis of all image elements "keyword">and metadata') print(&#x27;\nFiles created/updated "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin print(&#x27;=== ENHANCED ANALYSIS OF THIEME-BECKER IMAGES FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Deep analysis of image filenames, captions, "keyword">and content "keyword">for year dates') print(&#x27;Previous attempt found 3 images but missed potential chronological information') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # Get workspace directory workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Load the target webpage HTML target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(target_html_file): print(&#x27;‚ùå Target webpage HTML "keyword">not found') exit() print(f&#x27;Loading target webpage HTML: {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;‚úì HTML loaded "keyword">and parsed successfully') # Get page title title = soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Find main content main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(&#x27;\n=== COMPREHENSIVE IMAGE AND CHRONOLOGICAL DATE ANALYSIS ===') # Find all images "keyword">with enhanced analysis img_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f&#x27;Found {len(img_elements)} <img> elements') all_chronological_years = [] image_details = [] # Enhanced year pattern - more comprehensive year_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(1[0-9]{3})\b', # Years 1000-1999 r&#x27;\b(20[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 2000-2099 r&#x27;\b(19[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1900-1999 (more specific) r&#x27;\b(18[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1800-1899 r&#x27;\b(17[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1700-1799 r&#x27;\b(16[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1600-1699 r&#x27;\b(15[0-9]{2})\b' # Years 1500-1599 ] print(&#x27;\n=== DETAILED IMAGE ANALYSIS ===') "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(img_elements, 1): print(f&#x27;\nImage {i}:') # Get all image attributes src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') title_attr = img.get(&#x27;title', '') class_attr = img.get(&#x27;"keyword">class', []) # Convert relative URL to absolute "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): full_src = &#x27;https:' + src "keyword">elif src.startswith(&#x27;/'): full_src = urljoin(&#x27;https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', src) "keyword">else: full_src = src print(f&#x27; Source: {full_src}') print(f&#x27; Alt text: "{alt}"') print(f&#x27; Title: "{title_attr}"') print(f&#x27; Classes: {class_attr}') # Extract filename "keyword">from URL "keyword">for analysis filename = full_src.split(&#x27;/')[-1] "keyword">if '/' "keyword">in full_src "keyword">else full_src print(f&#x27; Filename: {filename}') # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in various sources sources_to_search = { &#x27;alt_text': alt, &#x27;title_attribute': title_attr, &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;full_url': full_src } found_years = [] "keyword">for source_name, source_text "keyword">in sources_to_search.items(): "keyword">if source_text: "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: years = re.findall(pattern, source_text) "keyword">if years: year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in years] found_years.extend(year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in {source_name}: {years}') # Get surrounding context (parent element "keyword">and siblings) parent = img.parent context_text = &#x27;' "keyword">if parent: context_text = parent.get_text() print(f&#x27; Parent element: <{parent.name}>') print(f&#x27; Context text: "{context_text[:100]}..." (first 100 chars)') # Search context "keyword">for years "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: context_years = re.findall(pattern, context_text) "keyword">if context_years: context_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in context_years] found_years.extend(context_year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in context: {context_years}') # Look "keyword">for figure captions "keyword">or nearby text # Check "keyword">if image "keyword">is within a figure "keyword">or has associated caption figure_parent = img.find_parent(&#x27;figure') "keyword">if figure_parent: figcaption = figure_parent.find(&#x27;figcaption') "keyword">if figcaption: caption_text = figcaption.get_text() print(f&#x27; Figure caption: "{caption_text}"') "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: caption_years = re.findall(pattern, caption_text) "keyword">if caption_years: caption_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in caption_years] found_years.extend(caption_year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in caption: {caption_years}') # Look "keyword">for thumb/image description divs thumb_div = img.find_parent(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;thumb' "keyword">in ' '.join(x) "keyword">if x "keyword">else "keyword">False) "keyword">if thumb_div: thumb_text = thumb_div.get_text() print(f&#x27; Thumbnail container text: "{thumb_text[:100]}..."') "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: thumb_years = re.findall(pattern, thumb_text) "keyword">if thumb_years: thumb_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in thumb_years] found_years.extend(thumb_year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in thumbnail container: {thumb_years}') # Remove duplicates "keyword">from found years unique_years = list(set(found_years)) "keyword">if unique_years: unique_years.sort() print(f&#x27; üìÖ Unique years found "keyword">for this image: {unique_years}') all_chronological_years.extend(unique_years) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">for this image') # Store detailed image information image_details.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': full_src, &#x27;alt': alt, &#x27;title': title_attr, &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;years_found': unique_years, &#x27;context_text': context_text[:200] "keyword">if context_text "keyword">else '', &#x27;has_figure_caption': figure_parent "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None, &#x27;has_thumb_container': thumb_div "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None }) # Process all found years all_unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_chronological_years))) print(f&#x27;\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total images analyzed: {len(img_elements)}') print(f&#x27;Total chronological years found: {len(all_unique_years)}') print(f&#x27;All years discovered: {all_unique_years}') "keyword">if all_unique_years: latest_year = max(all_unique_years) earliest_year = min(all_unique_years) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìÖ Earliest chronological year: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìä Year range span: {latest_year - earliest_year} years') # Show which images contained which years print(&#x27;\n=== YEAR DISTRIBUTION BY IMAGE ===') "keyword">for img_detail "keyword">in image_details: "keyword">if img_detail[&#x27;years_found']: print(f&#x27;Image {img_detail["image_number"]}: {img_detail["years_found"]}') print(f&#x27; Filename: {img_detail["filename"]}') "keyword">if img_detail[&#x27;alt']: print(f&#x27; Alt text: "{img_detail["alt"]}"') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">in any images') # Let's also search the entire page text "keyword">for any years that might be related to images print(&#x27;\n=== FALLBACK: SEARCHING ENTIRE PAGE TEXT FOR CHRONOLOGICAL YEARS ===') page_text = main_content.get_text() page_years = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: found_page_years = re.findall(pattern, page_text) "keyword">if found_page_years: page_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in found_page_years] page_years.extend(page_year_ints) unique_page_years = sorted(list(set(page_years))) print(f&#x27;Years found "keyword">in entire page text: {unique_page_years}') "keyword">if unique_page_years: latest_page_year = max(unique_page_years) print(f&#x27;Latest year "keyword">from page text: {latest_page_year}') print(&#x27;Note: These years may "keyword">not be directly related to images') # Create comprehensive analysis report analysis_report = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;target_webpage': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;analysis_method': 'Enhanced image analysis "keyword">with multiple year patterns' }, &#x27;image_analysis': { &#x27;total_images_found': len(img_elements), &#x27;images_with_chronological_data': len([img "keyword">for img "keyword">in image_details "keyword">if img['years_found']]), &#x27;total_unique_years_found': len(all_unique_years), &#x27;all_chronological_years': all_unique_years, &#x27;latest_year': max(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;earliest_year': min(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None }, &#x27;detailed_image_data': image_details, &#x27;search_methodology': { &#x27;year_patterns_used': year_patterns, &#x27;sources_analyzed': ['alt_text', 'title_attribute', 'filename', 'full_url', 'parent_context', 'figure_captions', 'thumbnail_containers'], &#x27;year_range_covered': '1500-2099' } } # Add fallback page analysis "keyword">if no image years found "keyword">if "keyword">not all_unique_years: page_text = main_content.get_text() page_years = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: found_page_years = re.findall(pattern, page_text) "keyword">if found_page_years: page_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in found_page_years] page_years.extend(page_year_ints) unique_page_years = sorted(list(set(page_years))) analysis_report[&#x27;fallback_page_analysis'] = { &#x27;page_years_found': unique_page_years, &#x27;latest_page_year': max(unique_page_years) "keyword">if unique_page_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;note': 'These years are "keyword">from entire page text, "keyword">not specifically "keyword">from images' } # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;enhanced_thieme_becker_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Enhanced chronological analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') # Final summary print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;ENHANCED THIEME-BECKER CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Find latest chronological year "keyword">in images on Thieme-Becker page') print(&#x27;Method: Enhanced analysis of image metadata, filenames, context, "keyword">and captions') "keyword">if all_unique_years: print(f&#x27;\n*** RESULT: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in images: {max(all_unique_years)} ***') print(f&#x27;Total years discovered: {all_unique_years}') print(f&#x27;Images containing chronological data: {len([img "keyword">for img "keyword">in image_details "keyword">if img["years_found"]])}/{len(img_elements)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n*** RESULT: No chronological years found "keyword">in image metadata "keyword">or context ***') print(&#x27;This suggests the images on this page do "keyword">not contain embedded chronological information') print(&#x27;Or the chronological data "keyword">is within the image content itself ("keyword">not accessible via HTML)') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output

tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:47:35

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and systematically analyzed the Thieme-Becker German Wikipedia page for images containing chronological dates. The analysis found 3 images embedded on the page but discovered no chronological year dates in their metadata, alt text, titles, or surrounding context. The code performed comprehensive image discovery using multiple approaches (img elements, figure elements, image-related classes) and thoroughly searched for year patterns (1000-2099) in all accessible metadata. The images found appear to be decorative elements (Wikisource logo, tracking pixel) rather than content with chronological significance. **PLAN** alignment: 95% complete - the systematic search was executed correctly and the target webpage was thoroughly analyzed. However, the core objective of finding the latest chronological year among images was not achieved because no such dates exist in the accessible image metadata on this particular page. The methodology was sound and the analysis comprehensive. Recommendation: Since the **PLAN** specifically seeks chronological dates 'written within' images, and HTML metadata analysis found none, the task has been completed to the extent possible with the available data. The page may simply not contain images with embedded chronological information, or such dates may only be visible within the actual image content (not accessible via HTML parsing).

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin print(&#x27;=== ENHANCED ANALYSIS OF THIEME-BECKER IMAGES FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Deep analysis of image filenames, captions, "keyword">and content "keyword">for year dates') print(&#x27;Previous attempt found 3 images but missed potential chronological information') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # Get workspace directory workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # Load the target webpage HTML target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(target_html_file): print(&#x27;‚ùå Target webpage HTML "keyword">not found') exit() print(f&#x27;Loading target webpage HTML: {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}') "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') print(&#x27;‚úì HTML loaded "keyword">and parsed successfully') # Get page title title = soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f&#x27;Page title: "{page_title}"') # Find main content main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup print(&#x27;\n=== COMPREHENSIVE IMAGE AND CHRONOLOGICAL DATE ANALYSIS ===') # Find all images "keyword">with enhanced analysis img_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f&#x27;Found {len(img_elements)} <img> elements') all_chronological_years = [] image_details = [] # Enhanced year pattern - more comprehensive year_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(1[0-9]{3})\b', # Years 1000-1999 r&#x27;\b(20[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 2000-2099 r&#x27;\b(19[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1900-1999 (more specific) r&#x27;\b(18[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1800-1899 r&#x27;\b(17[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1700-1799 r&#x27;\b(16[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1600-1699 r&#x27;\b(15[0-9]{2})\b' # Years 1500-1599 ] print(&#x27;\n=== DETAILED IMAGE ANALYSIS ===') "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(img_elements, 1): print(f&#x27;\nImage {i}:') # Get all image attributes src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') alt = img.get(&#x27;alt', '') title_attr = img.get(&#x27;title', '') class_attr = img.get(&#x27;"keyword">class', []) # Convert relative URL to absolute "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): full_src = &#x27;https:' + src "keyword">elif src.startswith(&#x27;/'): full_src = urljoin(&#x27;https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', src) "keyword">else: full_src = src print(f&#x27; Source: {full_src}') print(f&#x27; Alt text: "{alt}"') print(f&#x27; Title: "{title_attr}"') print(f&#x27; Classes: {class_attr}') # Extract filename "keyword">from URL "keyword">for analysis filename = full_src.split(&#x27;/')[-1] "keyword">if '/' "keyword">in full_src "keyword">else full_src print(f&#x27; Filename: {filename}') # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in various sources sources_to_search = { &#x27;alt_text': alt, &#x27;title_attribute': title_attr, &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;full_url': full_src } found_years = [] "keyword">for source_name, source_text "keyword">in sources_to_search.items(): "keyword">if source_text: "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: years = re.findall(pattern, source_text) "keyword">if years: year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in years] found_years.extend(year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in {source_name}: {years}') # Get surrounding context (parent element "keyword">and siblings) parent = img.parent context_text = &#x27;' "keyword">if parent: context_text = parent.get_text() print(f&#x27; Parent element: <{parent.name}>') print(f&#x27; Context text: "{context_text[:100]}..." (first 100 chars)') # Search context "keyword">for years "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: context_years = re.findall(pattern, context_text) "keyword">if context_years: context_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in context_years] found_years.extend(context_year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in context: {context_years}') # Look "keyword">for figure captions "keyword">or nearby text # Check "keyword">if image "keyword">is within a figure "keyword">or has associated caption figure_parent = img.find_parent(&#x27;figure') "keyword">if figure_parent: figcaption = figure_parent.find(&#x27;figcaption') "keyword">if figcaption: caption_text = figcaption.get_text() print(f&#x27; Figure caption: "{caption_text}"') "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: caption_years = re.findall(pattern, caption_text) "keyword">if caption_years: caption_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in caption_years] found_years.extend(caption_year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in caption: {caption_years}') # Look "keyword">for thumb/image description divs thumb_div = img.find_parent(class_="keyword">lambda x: x "keyword">and &#x27;thumb' "keyword">in ' '.join(x) "keyword">if x "keyword">else "keyword">False) "keyword">if thumb_div: thumb_text = thumb_div.get_text() print(f&#x27; Thumbnail container text: "{thumb_text[:100]}..."') "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: thumb_years = re.findall(pattern, thumb_text) "keyword">if thumb_years: thumb_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in thumb_years] found_years.extend(thumb_year_ints) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Years found "keyword">in thumbnail container: {thumb_years}') # Remove duplicates "keyword">from found years unique_years = list(set(found_years)) "keyword">if unique_years: unique_years.sort() print(f&#x27; üìÖ Unique years found "keyword">for this image: {unique_years}') all_chronological_years.extend(unique_years) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">for this image') # Store detailed image information image_details.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': full_src, &#x27;alt': alt, &#x27;title': title_attr, &#x27;filename': filename, &#x27;years_found': unique_years, &#x27;context_text': context_text[:200] "keyword">if context_text "keyword">else '', &#x27;has_figure_caption': figure_parent "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None, &#x27;has_thumb_container': thumb_div "keyword">is "keyword">not "keyword">None }) # Process all found years all_unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_chronological_years))) print(f&#x27;\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f&#x27;Total images analyzed: {len(img_elements)}') print(f&#x27;Total chronological years found: {len(all_unique_years)}') print(f&#x27;All years discovered: {all_unique_years}') "keyword">if all_unique_years: latest_year = max(all_unique_years) earliest_year = min(all_unique_years) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìÖ Earliest chronological year: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìä Year range span: {latest_year - earliest_year} years') # Show which images contained which years print(&#x27;\n=== YEAR DISTRIBUTION BY IMAGE ===') "keyword">for img_detail "keyword">in image_details: "keyword">if img_detail[&#x27;years_found']: print(f&#x27;Image {img_detail["image_number"]}: {img_detail["years_found"]}') print(f&#x27; Filename: {img_detail["filename"]}') "keyword">if img_detail[&#x27;alt']: print(f&#x27; Alt text: "{img_detail["alt"]}"') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">in any images') # Let's also search the entire page text "keyword">for any years that might be related to images print(&#x27;\n=== FALLBACK: SEARCHING ENTIRE PAGE TEXT FOR CHRONOLOGICAL YEARS ===') page_text = main_content.get_text() page_years = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: found_page_years = re.findall(pattern, page_text) "keyword">if found_page_years: page_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in found_page_years] page_years.extend(page_year_ints) unique_page_years = sorted(list(set(page_years))) print(f&#x27;Years found "keyword">in entire page text: {unique_page_years}') "keyword">if unique_page_years: latest_page_year = max(unique_page_years) print(f&#x27;Latest year "keyword">from page text: {latest_page_year}') print(&#x27;Note: These years may "keyword">not be directly related to images') # Create comprehensive analysis report analysis_report = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;target_webpage': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;analysis_method': 'Enhanced image analysis "keyword">with multiple year patterns' }, &#x27;image_analysis': { &#x27;total_images_found': len(img_elements), &#x27;images_with_chronological_data': len([img "keyword">for img "keyword">in image_details "keyword">if img['years_found']]), &#x27;total_unique_years_found': len(all_unique_years), &#x27;all_chronological_years': all_unique_years, &#x27;latest_year': max(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;earliest_year': min(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None }, &#x27;detailed_image_data': image_details, &#x27;search_methodology': { &#x27;year_patterns_used': year_patterns, &#x27;sources_analyzed': ['alt_text', 'title_attribute', 'filename', 'full_url', 'parent_context', 'figure_captions', 'thumbnail_containers'], &#x27;year_range_covered': '1500-2099' } } # Add fallback page analysis "keyword">if no image years found "keyword">if "keyword">not all_unique_years: page_text = main_content.get_text() page_years = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: found_page_years = re.findall(pattern, page_text) "keyword">if found_page_years: page_year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in found_page_years] page_years.extend(page_year_ints) unique_page_years = sorted(list(set(page_years))) analysis_report[&#x27;fallback_page_analysis'] = { &#x27;page_years_found': unique_page_years, &#x27;latest_page_year': max(unique_page_years) "keyword">if unique_page_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;note': 'These years are "keyword">from entire page text, "keyword">not specifically "keyword">from images' } # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;enhanced_thieme_becker_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Enhanced chronological analysis saved to {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') # Final summary print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;ENHANCED THIEME-BECKER CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Find latest chronological year "keyword">in images on Thieme-Becker page') print(&#x27;Method: Enhanced analysis of image metadata, filenames, context, "keyword">and captions') "keyword">if all_unique_years: print(f&#x27;\n*** RESULT: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in images: {max(all_unique_years)} ***') print(f&#x27;Total years discovered: {all_unique_years}') print(f&#x27;Images containing chronological data: {len([img "keyword">for img "keyword">in image_details "keyword">if img["years_found"]])}/{len(img_elements)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n*** RESULT: No chronological years found "keyword">in image metadata "keyword">or context ***') print(&#x27;This suggests the images on this page do "keyword">not contain embedded chronological information') print(&#x27;Or the chronological data "keyword">is within the image content itself ("keyword">not accessible via HTML)') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output

(first 100 chars) ‚ö† No chronological years found for this image === CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS === Total images analyzed: 3 Total chronological years found: 0 All years discovered: [] ‚ö† No chronological years found in any images === FALLBACK: SEARCHING ENTIRE PAGE TEXT FOR CHRONOLOGICAL YEARS === Years found in entire page text: [1157, 1158, 1200, 1763, 1779, 1801, 1806, 1808, 1809, 1810, 1812, 1813, 1814, 1818, 1820, 1821, 1830, 1832, 1835, 1840, 1852, 1858, 1866, 1867, 1870, 1872, 1878, 1879, 1882, 1884, 1885, 1888, 1893, 1895, 1896, 1898, 1901, 1904, 1905, 1906, 1907, 1908, 1909, 1910, 1911, 1912, 1913, 1914, 1915, 1916, 1917, 1919, 1920, 1921, 1922, 1923, 1924, 1925, 1926, 1927, 1928, 1929, 1930, 1931, 1932, 1933, 1934, 1935, 1936, 1937, 1938, 1939, 1940, 1942, 1943, 1944, 1946, 1947, 1948, 1950, 1953, 1954, 1955, 1956, 1957, 1958, 1961, 1962, 1978, 1983, 1986, 1992, 1993, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1999, 2008, 2012] Latest year from page text: 2012 Note: These years may not be directly related to images ‚úì Enhanced chronological analysis saved to enhanced_thieme_becker_chronological_analysis.json ================================================================================ ENHANCED THIEME-BECKER CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE ================================================================================ Objective: Find latest chronological year in images on Thieme-Becker page Method: Enhanced analysis of image metadata, filenames, context, and captions *** RESULT: No chronological years found in image metadata or context *** This suggests the images on this page do not contain embedded chronological information Or the chronological data is within the image content itself (not accessible via HTML) Files created in workspace: - developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 3)
2025-08-11 06:49:00

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">import os "keyword">import re "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file print(&#x27;=== ANALYZING ACTUAL IMAGE CONTENT FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES USING OCR ===') print(&#x27;Objective: Download images "keyword">and use OCR to extract text written within the images') print(&#x27;Previous HTML metadata analysis found no chronological dates - now analyzing image content') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80 + '\n') # Get workspace directory workspace_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if f.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if "keyword">not workspace_files: print(&#x27;‚ùå No workspace directory found') exit() workspace_dir = workspace_files[0] print(f&#x27;Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') # First, let's inspect the existing analysis to understand what images we have analysis_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if &#x27;analysis' "keyword">in f "keyword">and f.endswith('.json')] print(f&#x27;\nAvailable analysis files: {analysis_files}') "keyword">if analysis_files: # Load the most recent analysis file latest_analysis = analysis_files[-1] analysis_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, latest_analysis) print(f&#x27;Loading analysis "keyword">from: {latest_analysis}') # First inspect the file structure "keyword">with open(analysis_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;\nAnalysis file structure:') "keyword">for key "keyword">in analysis_data.keys(): print(f&#x27; - {key}: {type(analysis_data[key])}') # Check "keyword">if we have detailed image data "keyword">if &#x27;detailed_image_data' "keyword">in analysis_data: image_data = analysis_data[&#x27;detailed_image_data'] print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(image_data)} images "keyword">in analysis data') "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(image_data, 1): print(f&#x27; Image {i}: {img.get("filename", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Source: {img.get("src", "")[:80]}...') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No detailed image data found "keyword">in analysis file') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No analysis files found - will need to re-parse webpage') # Load target webpage HTML to get images target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;target_webpage_content.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(target_html_file): print(&#x27;‚ùå Target webpage HTML "keyword">not found') exit() "keyword">with open(target_html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">or soup img_elements = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') image_data = [] "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(img_elements, 1): src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') "keyword">if src.startswith(&#x27;//'): src = &#x27;https:' + src image_data.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;filename': src.split('/')[-1] "keyword">if '/' "keyword">in src "keyword">else src }) print(f&#x27;\nExtracted {len(image_data)} images "keyword">from HTML') print(&#x27;\n=== DOWNLOADING IMAGES FOR OCR ANALYSIS ===') # Create images subdirectory images_dir = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;downloaded_images') os.makedirs(images_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f&#x27;Created images directory: {os.path.basename(images_dir)}') # Download each image "keyword">for OCR analysis downloaded_images = [] headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(image_data, 1): print(f&#x27;\nDownloading Image {i}:') print(f&#x27; Source: {img_info["src"]}') print(f&#x27; Filename: {img_info["filename"]}') "keyword">try: # Download the image response = requests.get(img_info[&#x27;src'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Download status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Determine file extension content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;jpeg' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or 'jpg' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.jpg' "keyword">elif &#x27;png' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.png' "keyword">elif &#x27;gif' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.gif' "keyword">elif &#x27;svg' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.svg' "keyword">else: # Try to get extension "keyword">from filename original_filename = img_info[&#x27;filename'] "keyword">if &#x27;.' "keyword">in original_filename: ext = &#x27;.' + original_filename.split('.')[-1] "keyword">else: ext = &#x27;.jpg' # Default # Save "keyword">with descriptive filename local_filename = f&#x27;image_{i:02d}_{img_info["filename"].split("?")[0][:50]}{ext}' local_path = os.path.join(images_dir, local_filename) "keyword">with open(local_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) file_size = os.path.getsize(local_path) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Saved "keyword">as: {local_filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') downloaded_images.append({ &#x27;original_info': img_info, &#x27;local_path': local_path, &#x27;local_filename': local_filename, &#x27;file_size': file_size, &#x27;content_type': content_type }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Download failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Download error: {str(e)}') print(f&#x27;\nüìä Successfully downloaded {len(downloaded_images)} images') "keyword">if len(downloaded_images) == 0: print(&#x27;‚ùå No images were downloaded - cannot perform OCR analysis') exit() print(&#x27;\n=== PERFORMING OCR ANALYSIS ON DOWNLOADED IMAGES ===') # Initialize Hugging Face OCR client print(&#x27;Initializing OCR client...') "keyword">try: client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") print(&#x27;‚úì OCR client initialized successfully') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Failed to initialize OCR client: {str(e)}') exit() # Analyze each downloaded image "keyword">with OCR all_chronological_years = [] image_ocr_results = [] # Enhanced year patterns "keyword">for OCR text year_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(1[0-9]{3})\b', # Years 1000-1999 r&#x27;\b(20[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 2000-2099 r&#x27;\b(19[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1900-1999 r&#x27;\b(18[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1800-1899 r&#x27;\b(17[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1700-1799 r&#x27;\b(16[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1600-1699 r&#x27;\b(15[0-9]{2})\b' # Years 1500-1599 ] "keyword">for i, img_data "keyword">in enumerate(downloaded_images, 1): print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing Image {i} "keyword">with OCR:') print(f&#x27; File: {img_data["local_filename"]}') print(f&#x27; Size: {img_data["file_size"]:,} bytes') "keyword">try: # Perform OCR using Hugging Face Tesseract print(&#x27; Running OCR...') ocr_result = client.predict( handle_file(img_data[&#x27;local_path']) ) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f&#x27; ‚úì OCR extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters') print(f&#x27; Text preview: "{extracted_text[:100]}..."') # Search "keyword">for chronological years "keyword">in OCR text found_years = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: years = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text) "keyword">if years: year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in years] found_years.extend(year_ints) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort unique_years = sorted(list(set(found_years))) "keyword">if unique_years: print(f&#x27; üéØ Years found "keyword">in image: {unique_years}') all_chronological_years.extend(unique_years) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">in OCR text') image_ocr_results.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;filename': img_data['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img_data['original_info']['src'], &#x27;ocr_text': extracted_text, &#x27;years_found': unique_years, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† No text extracted "keyword">from image') image_ocr_results.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;filename': img_data['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img_data['original_info']['src'], &#x27;ocr_text': '', &#x27;years_found': [], &#x27;text_length': 0 }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(e)}') image_ocr_results.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;filename': img_data['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img_data['original_info']['src'], &#x27;ocr_text': f'OCR_ERROR: {str(e)}', &#x27;years_found': [], &#x27;text_length': 0, &#x27;error': str(e) }) # Process final results all_unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_chronological_years))) print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;OCR CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print(&#x27;='*80) print(f&#x27;Total images analyzed: {len(downloaded_images)}') print(f&#x27;Images "keyword">with extractable text: {len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_ocr_results "keyword">if r["text_length"] > 0])}') print(f&#x27;Total chronological years found: {len(all_unique_years)}') print(f&#x27;All years discovered: {all_unique_years}') "keyword">if all_unique_years: latest_year = max(all_unique_years) earliest_year = min(all_unique_years) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR FOUND IN IMAGES: {latest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìÖ Earliest chronological year: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìä Year range span: {latest_year - earliest_year} years') # Show which images contained which years print(&#x27;\n=== YEAR DISTRIBUTION BY IMAGE ===') "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_ocr_results: "keyword">if result[&#x27;years_found']: print(f&#x27;Image {result["image_number"]} ({result["filename"]}): {result["years_found"]}') "keyword">if result[&#x27;ocr_text']: print(f&#x27; OCR text: "{result["ocr_text"][:100]}..."') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">in any image content via OCR') print(&#x27;This indicates that the images either:') print(&#x27; - Do "keyword">not contain any text "keyword">with chronological dates') print(&#x27; - Have text that "keyword">is "keyword">not readable by OCR (stylized fonts, poor quality, etc.)') print(&#x27; - Are purely visual/decorative without textual chronological information') # Create comprehensive OCR analysis report ocr_analysis_report = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;target_webpage': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;analysis_method': 'OCR text extraction "keyword">from downloaded image content', &#x27;ocr_service': 'Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR' }, &#x27;image_analysis': { &#x27;total_images_found': len(image_data), &#x27;images_successfully_downloaded': len(downloaded_images), &#x27;images_with_extractable_text': len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_ocr_results "keyword">if r['text_length'] > 0]), &#x27;images_with_chronological_data': len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_ocr_results "keyword">if r['years_found']]), &#x27;total_unique_years_found': len(all_unique_years), &#x27;all_chronological_years': all_unique_years, &#x27;latest_year': max(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;earliest_year': min(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None }, &#x27;detailed_ocr_results': image_ocr_results, &#x27;downloaded_images': [{ &#x27;filename': img['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img['original_info']['src'], &#x27;file_size': img['file_size'], &#x27;content_type': img['content_type'] } "keyword">for img "keyword">in downloaded_images], &#x27;search_methodology': { &#x27;year_patterns_used': year_patterns, &#x27;year_range_covered': '1500-2099', &#x27;ocr_approach': 'Full text extraction "keyword">with regex pattern matching' } } # Save comprehensive OCR analysis ocr_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_ocr_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(ocr_analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(ocr_analysis_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete OCR analysis saved to {os.path.basename(ocr_analysis_file)}') # Final summary print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;THIEME-BECKER IMAGE OCR ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Extract chronological dates written within images using OCR') print(&#x27;Method: Download images "keyword">and analyze content "keyword">with Tesseract OCR') "keyword">if all_unique_years: print(f&#x27;\n*** FINAL RESULT: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in images: {max(all_unique_years)} ***') print(f&#x27;This year was extracted "keyword">from the actual image content using OCR technology') print(f&#x27;Total chronological years discovered: {all_unique_years}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n*** FINAL RESULT: No chronological years found "keyword">in image content ***') print(&#x27;The images on this Thieme-Becker page do "keyword">not contain readable chronological dates') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if os.path.exists(images_dir): print(f&#x27;\nDownloaded images "keyword">in {os.path.basename(images_dir)}:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(images_dir)): file_path = os.path.join(images_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === ANALYZING ACTUAL IMAGE CONTENT FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES USING OCR === Objective: Download images and use OCR to extract text written within the images Previous HTML metadata analysis found no chronological dates - now analyzing image content ================================================================================ Using workspace directory: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f Available analysis files: ['enhanced_thieme_becker_chronological_analysis.json', 'target_webpage_analysis.json'] Loading analysis from: target_webpage_analysis.json Analysis file structure: - citation_source: <class 'dict'> - target_webpage: <class 'dict'> - content_analysis: <class 'dict'> - external_links: <class 'list'> - access_info: <class 'dict'> ‚ö† No detailed image data found in analysis file === DOWNLOADING IMAGES FOR OCR ANALYSIS === Created images directory: downloaded_images Execution error: NameError: name 'image_data' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 469, in _execute_in_environment exec(code, execution_globals, execution_globals) File "<string>", line 96, in <module> NameError: name 'image_data' is not defined
tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:49:00

Execution failed - Code ran but failed to achieve the **PLAN** objective due to a fundamental methodology limitation. The code successfully accessed the target webpage and found 3 images, but only analyzed HTML metadata (alt text, titles, filenames) rather than the actual visual content within the images as required by the **PLAN**. The **PLAN** specifically states to 'extract and analyze each image to identify chronological year dates written within them' - meaning OCR analysis of the actual image content, not just HTML attributes. The fallback page text search found years up to 2012, but these aren't from images. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - webpage accessed and images identified correctly, but the core requirement to analyze visual content within images was not implemented. Next step: Download the 3 identified images and use OCR (Optical Character Recognition) technology to extract text written within the actual image content, then search that extracted text for chronological year dates. The current approach of analyzing HTML metadata alone cannot detect dates that are visually embedded within image pixels.

üìù Code Python

Download status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Determine file extension content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;jpeg' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or 'jpg' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.jpg' "keyword">elif &#x27;png' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.png' "keyword">elif &#x27;gif' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.gif' "keyword">elif &#x27;svg' "keyword">in content_type: ext = &#x27;.svg' "keyword">else: # Try to get extension "keyword">from filename original_filename = img_info[&#x27;filename'] "keyword">if &#x27;.' "keyword">in original_filename: ext = &#x27;.' + original_filename.split('.')[-1] "keyword">else: ext = &#x27;.jpg' # Default # Save "keyword">with descriptive filename local_filename = f&#x27;image_{i:02d}_{img_info["filename"].split("?")[0][:50]}{ext}' local_path = os.path.join(images_dir, local_filename) "keyword">with open(local_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.content) file_size = os.path.getsize(local_path) print(f&#x27; ‚úì Saved "keyword">as: {local_filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') downloaded_images.append({ &#x27;original_info': img_info, &#x27;local_path': local_path, &#x27;local_filename': local_filename, &#x27;file_size': file_size, &#x27;content_type': content_type }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Download failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Download error: {str(e)}') print(f&#x27;\nüìä Successfully downloaded {len(downloaded_images)} images') "keyword">if len(downloaded_images) == 0: print(&#x27;‚ùå No images were downloaded - cannot perform OCR analysis') exit() print(&#x27;\n=== PERFORMING OCR ANALYSIS ON DOWNLOADED IMAGES ===') # Initialize Hugging Face OCR client print(&#x27;Initializing OCR client...') "keyword">try: client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") print(&#x27;‚úì OCR client initialized successfully') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Failed to initialize OCR client: {str(e)}') exit() # Analyze each downloaded image "keyword">with OCR all_chronological_years = [] image_ocr_results = [] # Enhanced year patterns "keyword">for OCR text year_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(1[0-9]{3})\b', # Years 1000-1999 r&#x27;\b(20[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 2000-2099 r&#x27;\b(19[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1900-1999 r&#x27;\b(18[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1800-1899 r&#x27;\b(17[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1700-1799 r&#x27;\b(16[0-9]{2})\b', # Years 1600-1699 r&#x27;\b(15[0-9]{2})\b' # Years 1500-1599 ] "keyword">for i, img_data "keyword">in enumerate(downloaded_images, 1): print(f&#x27;\nAnalyzing Image {i} "keyword">with OCR:') print(f&#x27; File: {img_data["local_filename"]}') print(f&#x27; Size: {img_data["file_size"]:,} bytes') "keyword">try: # Perform OCR using Hugging Face Tesseract print(&#x27; Running OCR...') ocr_result = client.predict( handle_file(img_data[&#x27;local_path']) ) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f&#x27; ‚úì OCR extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters') print(f&#x27; Text preview: "{extracted_text[:100]}..."') # Search "keyword">for chronological years "keyword">in OCR text found_years = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in year_patterns: years = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text) "keyword">if years: year_ints = [int(year) "keyword">for year "keyword">in years] found_years.extend(year_ints) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort unique_years = sorted(list(set(found_years))) "keyword">if unique_years: print(f&#x27; üéØ Years found "keyword">in image: {unique_years}') all_chronological_years.extend(unique_years) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">in OCR text') image_ocr_results.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;filename': img_data['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img_data['original_info']['src'], &#x27;ocr_text': extracted_text, &#x27;years_found': unique_years, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† No text extracted "keyword">from image') image_ocr_results.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;filename': img_data['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img_data['original_info']['src'], &#x27;ocr_text': '', &#x27;years_found': [], &#x27;text_length': 0 }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(e)}') image_ocr_results.append({ &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;filename': img_data['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img_data['original_info']['src'], &#x27;ocr_text': f'OCR_ERROR: {str(e)}', &#x27;years_found': [], &#x27;text_length': 0, &#x27;error': str(e) }) # Process final results all_unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_chronological_years))) print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;OCR CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print(&#x27;='*80) print(f&#x27;Total images analyzed: {len(downloaded_images)}') print(f&#x27;Images "keyword">with extractable text: {len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_ocr_results "keyword">if r["text_length"] > 0])}') print(f&#x27;Total chronological years found: {len(all_unique_years)}') print(f&#x27;All years discovered: {all_unique_years}') "keyword">if all_unique_years: latest_year = max(all_unique_years) earliest_year = min(all_unique_years) print(f&#x27;\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR FOUND IN IMAGES: {latest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìÖ Earliest chronological year: {earliest_year}') print(f&#x27;üìä Year range span: {latest_year - earliest_year} years') # Show which images contained which years print(&#x27;\n=== YEAR DISTRIBUTION BY IMAGE ===') "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_ocr_results: "keyword">if result[&#x27;years_found']: print(f&#x27;Image {result["image_number"]} ({result["filename"]}): {result["years_found"]}') "keyword">if result[&#x27;ocr_text']: print(f&#x27; OCR text: "{result["ocr_text"][:100]}..."') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chronological years found "keyword">in any image content via OCR') print(&#x27;This indicates that the images either:') print(&#x27; - Do "keyword">not contain any text "keyword">with chronological dates') print(&#x27; - Have text that "keyword">is "keyword">not readable by OCR (stylized fonts, poor quality, etc.)') print(&#x27; - Are purely visual/decorative without textual chronological information') # Create comprehensive OCR analysis report ocr_analysis_report = { &#x27;source_info': { &#x27;target_webpage': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;analysis_method': 'OCR text extraction "keyword">from downloaded image content', &#x27;ocr_service': 'Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR' }, &#x27;image_analysis': { &#x27;total_images_found': len(image_data), &#x27;images_successfully_downloaded': len(downloaded_images), &#x27;images_with_extractable_text': len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_ocr_results "keyword">if r['text_length'] > 0]), &#x27;images_with_chronological_data': len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_ocr_results "keyword">if r['years_found']]), &#x27;total_unique_years_found': len(all_unique_years), &#x27;all_chronological_years': all_unique_years, &#x27;latest_year': max(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;earliest_year': min(all_unique_years) "keyword">if all_unique_years "keyword">else "keyword">None }, &#x27;detailed_ocr_results': image_ocr_results, &#x27;downloaded_images': [{ &#x27;filename': img['local_filename'], &#x27;original_src': img['original_info']['src'], &#x27;file_size': img['file_size'], &#x27;content_type': img['content_type'] } "keyword">for img "keyword">in downloaded_images], &#x27;search_methodology': { &#x27;year_patterns_used': year_patterns, &#x27;year_range_covered': '1500-2099', &#x27;ocr_approach': 'Full text extraction "keyword">with regex pattern matching' } } # Save comprehensive OCR analysis ocr_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_ocr_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(ocr_analysis_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(ocr_analysis_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Complete OCR analysis saved to {os.path.basename(ocr_analysis_file)}') # Final summary print(&#x27;\n' + '='*80) print(&#x27;THIEME-BECKER IMAGE OCR ANALYSIS COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*80) print(&#x27;Objective: Extract chronological dates written within images using OCR') print(&#x27;Method: Download images "keyword">and analyze content "keyword">with Tesseract OCR') "keyword">if all_unique_years: print(f&#x27;\n*** FINAL RESULT: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in images: {max(all_unique_years)} ***') print(f&#x27;This year was extracted "keyword">from the actual image content using OCR technology') print(f&#x27;Total chronological years discovered: {all_unique_years}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n*** FINAL RESULT: No chronological years found "keyword">in image content ***') print(&#x27;The images on this Thieme-Becker page do "keyword">not contain readable chronological dates') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): "keyword">if file.endswith((&#x27;.json', '.html', '.txt')): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">if os.path.exists(images_dir): print(f&#x27;\nDownloaded images "keyword">in {os.path.basename(images_dir)}:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(images_dir)): file_path = os.path.join(images_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)')
üìÑ Output
