{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nimport os\nimport re\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin\nfrom gradio_client import Client, handle_file\n\nprint(\'=== ANALYZING ACTUAL IMAGE CONTENT FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES USING OCR ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Download images and use OCR to extract text written within the images\')\nprint(\'Previous HTML metadata analysis found no chronological dates - now analyzing image content\')\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80 + \'\\n\')\n\n# Get workspace directory\nworkspace_files = [f for f in os.listdir(\'.\') if f.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif not workspace_files:\n print(\'‚ùå No workspace directory found\')\n exit()\n\nworkspace_dir = workspace_files[0]\nprint(f\'Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\')\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the existing analysis to understand what images we have\nanalysis_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if \'analysis\' in f and f.endswith(\'.json\')]\nprint(f\'\\nAvailable analysis files: {analysis_files}\')\n\nif analysis_files:\n # Load the most recent analysis file\n latest_analysis = analysis_files[-1]\n analysis_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, latest_analysis)\n print(f\'Loading analysis from: {latest_analysis}\')\n \n # First inspect the file structure\n with open(analysis_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n analysis_data = json.load(f)\n \n print(\'\\nAnalysis file structure:\')\n for key in analysis_data.keys():\n print(f\' - {key}: {type(analysis_data[key])}\')\n \n # Check if we have detailed image data\n if \'detailed_image_data\' in analysis_data:\n image_data = analysis_data[\'detailed_image_data\']\n print(f\'\\nFound {len(image_data)} images in analysis data\')\n \n for i, img in enumerate(image_data, 1):\n print(f\' Image {i}: {img.get("filename", "Unknown")}\') \n print(f\' Source: {img.get("src", "")[:80]}...\')\n else:\n print(\'\\n‚ö† No detailed image data found in analysis file\')\nelse:\n print(\'\\n‚ö† No analysis files found - will need to re-parse webpage\')\n # Load target webpage HTML to get images\n target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'target_webpage_content.html\')\n if not os.path.exists(target_html_file):\n print(\'‚ùå Target webpage HTML not found\')\n exit()\n \n with open(target_html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'}) or soup\n img_elements = main_content.find_all(\'img\')\n \n image_data = []\n for i, img in enumerate(img_elements, 1):\n src = img.get(\'src\', \'\')\n if src.startswith(\'//\'):\n src = \'https:\' + src\n \n image_data.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'src\': src,\n \'alt\': img.get(\'alt\', \'\'),\n \'title\': img.get(\'title\', \'\'),\n \'filename\': src.split(\'/\')[-1] if \'/\' in src else src\n })\n \n print(f\'\\nExtracted {len(image_data)} images from HTML\')\n\nprint(\'\\n=== DOWNLOADING IMAGES FOR OCR ANALYSIS ===\')\n\n# Create images subdirectory\nimages_dir = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'downloaded_images\')\nos.makedirs(images_dir, exist_ok=True)\nprint(f\'Created images directory: {os.path.basename(images_dir)}\')\n\n# Download each image for OCR analysis\ndownloaded_images = []\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n}\n\nfor i, img_info in enumerate(image_data, 1):\n print(f\'\\nDownloading Image {i}:\')\n print(f\' Source: {img_info["src"]}\')\n print(f\' Filename: {img_info["filename"]}\')\n \n try:\n # Download the image\n response = requests.get(img_info[\'src\'], headers=headers, timeout=30)\n print(f\' Download status: {response.status_code}\')\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n # Determine file extension\n content_type = response.headers.get(\'content-type\', \'\').lower()\n if \'jpeg\' in content_type or \'jpg\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.jpg\'\n elif \'png\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.png\'\n elif \'gif\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.gif\'\n elif \'svg\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.svg\'\n else:\n # Try to get extension from filename\n original_filename = img_info[\'filename\']\n if \'.\' in original_filename:\n ext = \'.\' + original_filename.split(\'.\')[-1]\n else:\n ext = \'.jpg\' # Default\n \n # Save with descriptive filename\n local_filename = f\'image_{i:02d}_{img_info["filename"].split("?")[0][:50]}{ext}\'\n local_path = os.path.join(images_dir, local_filename)\n \n with open(local_path, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(response.content)\n \n file_size = os.path.getsize(local_path)\n print(f\' ‚úì Saved as: {local_filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')\n \n downloaded_images.append({\n \'original_info\': img_info,\n \'local_path\': local_path,\n \'local_filename\': local_filename,\n \'file_size\': file_size,\n \'content_type\': content_type\n })\n else:\n print(f\' ‚ùå Download failed: HTTP {response.status_code}\')\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' ‚ùå Download error: {str(e)}\')\n\nprint(f\'\\nüìä Successfully downloaded {len(downloaded_images)} images\')\n\nif len(downloaded_images) == 0:\n print(\'‚ùå No images were downloaded - cannot perform OCR analysis\')\n exit()\n\nprint(\'\\n=== PERFORMING OCR ANALYSIS ON DOWNLOADED IMAGES ===\')\n\n# Initialize Hugging Face OCR client\nprint(\'Initializing OCR client...\')\ntry:\n client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR")\n print(\'‚úì OCR client initialized successfully\')\nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f\'‚ùå Failed to initialize OCR client: {str(e)}\')\n exit()\n\n# Analyze each downloaded image with OCR\nall_chronological_years = []\nimage_ocr_results = []\n\n# Enhanced year patterns for OCR text\nyear_patterns = [\n r\'\\b(1[0-9]{3})\\b\', # Years 1000-1999\n r\'\\b(20[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 2000-2099\n r\'\\b(19[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1900-1999\n r\'\\b(18[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1800-1899\n r\'\\b(17[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1700-1799\n r\'\\b(16[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1600-1699\n r\'\\b(15[0-9]{2})\\b\' # Years 1500-1599\n]\n\nfor i, img_data in enumerate(downloaded_images, 1):\n print(f\'\\nAnalyzing Image {i} with OCR:\')\n print(f\' File: {img_data["local_filename"]}\')\n print(f\' Size: {img_data["file_size"]:,} bytes\')\n \n try:\n # Perform OCR using Hugging Face Tesseract\n print(\' Running OCR...\')\n ocr_result = client.predict(\n handle_file(img_data[\'local_path\'])\n )\n \n if ocr_result and ocr_result.strip():\n extracted_text = ocr_result.strip()\n print(f\' ‚úì OCR extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters\')\n print(f\' Text preview: "{extracted_text[:100]}..."\')\n \n # Search for chronological years in OCR text\n found_years = []\n for pattern in year_patterns:\n years = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text)\n if years:\n year_ints = [int(year) for year in years]\n found_years.extend(year_ints)\n \n # Remove duplicates and sort\n unique_years = sorted(list(set(found_years)))\n \n if unique_years:\n print(f\' üéØ Years found in image: {unique_years}\')\n all_chronological_years.extend(unique_years)\n else:\n print(f\' ‚ö† No chronological years found in OCR text\')\n \n image_ocr_results.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'filename\': img_data[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img_data[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'ocr_text\': extracted_text,\n \'years_found\': unique_years,\n \'text_length\': len(extracted_text)\n })\n \n else:\n print(f\' ‚ö† No text extracted from image\')\n image_ocr_results.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'filename\': img_data[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img_data[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'ocr_text\': \'\',\n \'years_found\': [],\n \'text_length\': 0\n })\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' ‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(e)}\')\n image_ocr_results.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'filename\': img_data[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img_data[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'ocr_text\': f\'OCR_ERROR: {str(e)}\',\n \'years_found\': [],\n \'text_length\': 0,\n \'error\': str(e)\n })\n\n# Process final results\nall_unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_chronological_years)))\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'OCR CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\nprint(f\'Total images analyzed: {len(downloaded_images)}\')\nprint(f\'Images with extractable text: {len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r["text_length"] > 0])}\')\nprint(f\'Total chronological years found: {len(all_unique_years)}\')\nprint(f\'All years discovered: {all_unique_years}\')\n\nif all_unique_years:\n latest_year = max(all_unique_years)\n earliest_year = min(all_unique_years)\n \n print(f\'\\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR FOUND IN IMAGES: {latest_year}\')\n print(f\'üìÖ Earliest chronological year: {earliest_year}\')\n print(f\'üìä Year range span: {latest_year - earliest_year} years\')\n \n # Show which images contained which years\n print(\'\\n=== YEAR DISTRIBUTION BY IMAGE ===\') \n for result in image_ocr_results:\n if result[\'years_found\']:\n print(f\'Image {result["image_number"]} ({result["filename"]}): {result["years_found"]}\')\n if result[\'ocr_text\']:\n print(f\' OCR text: "{result["ocr_text"][:100]}..."\')\nelse:\n print(\'\\n‚ö† No chronological years found in any image content via OCR\')\n print(\'This indicates that the images either:\')\n print(\' - Do not contain any text with chronological dates\')\n print(\' - Have text that is not readable by OCR (stylized fonts, poor quality, etc.)\')\n print(\' - Are purely visual/decorative without textual chronological information\')\n\n# Create comprehensive OCR analysis report\nocr_analysis_report = {\n \'source_info\': {\n \'target_webpage\': \'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\',\n \'analysis_timestamp\': time.strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'analysis_method\': \'OCR text extraction from downloaded image content\',\n \'ocr_service\': \'Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR\'\n },\n \'image_analysis\': {\n \'total_images_found\': len(image_data),\n \'images_successfully_downloaded\': len(downloaded_images),\n \'images_with_extractable_text\': len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r[\'text_length\'] > 0]),\n \'images_with_chronological_data\': len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r[\'years_found\']]),\n \'total_unique_years_found\': len(all_unique_years),\n \'all_chronological_years\': all_unique_years,\n \'latest_year\': max(all_unique_years) if all_unique_years else None,\n \'earliest_year\': min(all_unique_years) if all_unique_years else None\n },\n \'detailed_ocr_results\': image_ocr_results,\n \'downloaded_images\': [{\n \'filename\': img[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'file_size\': img[\'file_size\'],\n \'content_type\': img[\'content_type\']\n } for img in downloaded_images],\n \'search_methodology\': {\n \'year_patterns_used\': year_patterns,\n \'year_range_covered\': \'1500-2099\',\n \'ocr_approach\': \'Full text extraction with regex pattern matching\'\n }\n}\n\n# Save comprehensive OCR analysis\nocr_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_ocr_chronological_analysis.json\')\nwith open(ocr_analysis_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(ocr_analysis_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f\'\\n‚úì Complete OCR analysis saved to {os.path.basename(ocr_analysis_file)}\')\n\n# Final summary\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'THIEME-BECKER IMAGE OCR ANALYSIS COMPLETE\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\nprint(\'Objective: Extract chronological dates written within images using OCR\')\nprint(\'Method: Download images and analyze content with Tesseract OCR\')\n\nif all_unique_years:\n print(f\'\\n*** FINAL RESULT: Latest chronological year found in images: {max(all_unique_years)} ***\')\n print(f\'This year was extracted from the actual image content using OCR technology\')\n print(f\'Total chronological years discovered: {all_unique_years}\')\nelse:\n print(\'\\n*** FINAL RESULT: No chronological years found in image content ***\')\n print(\'The images on this Thieme-Becker page do not contain readable chronological dates\')\n\nprint(\'\\nFiles created in workspace:\')\nfor file in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)):\n if file.endswith((\'.json\', \'.html\', \'.txt\')):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f\'- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')\n\nif os.path.exists(images_dir):\n print(f\'\\nDownloaded images in {os.path.basename(images_dir)}:\')\n for file in sorted(os.listdir(images_dir)):\n file_path = os.path.join(images_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f\'- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')',
"description": 'This implementation addresses the core **PLAN** objective by analyzing the actual content within images rather than just HTML metadata. The approach includes:\n\n1. **File Structure Inspection**: First examines existing analysis files to understand the available image data structure before attempting to access specific keys, following best practices for working with intermediate outputs.\n\n2. **Image Download**: Downloads all images found on the Thieme-Becker page to local storage, handling different image formats (JPG, PNG, SVG, GIF) and creating descriptive filenames for organization.\n\n3. **OCR Text Extraction**: Uses Hugging Face\'s Tesseract-OCR service to extract any text that is visually embedded within the images themselves, which is the only way to access chronological dates that are "written within" images as specified in the **PLAN**.\n\n4. **Comprehensive Year Pattern Matching**: Applies multiple regex patterns to the OCR-extracted text to identify chronological years across different centuries (1500-2099), ensuring no potential dates are missed.\n\n5. **Latest Year Identification**: Determines the most recent chronological year among all dates found within the image content, directly answering the **PLAN** objective.\n\n6. **Detailed Documentation**: Creates comprehensive analysis including OCR results for each image, chronological years discovered, and methodology used.\n\nThis OCR-based approach is essential because the previous HTML metadata analysis found no chronological information, suggesting that any year dates are embedded as text within the image content itself rather than in HTML attributes. This is the only reliable method to extract chronological dates that are visually written within images on the webpage.',

The fallback page text search found years up to 2012, but these aren't from images. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - webpage accessed and images identified correctly, but the core requirement to analyze visual content within images was not implemented. "role": 'developer',
"code": 'import requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nimport os\nimport re\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin\nfrom gradio_client import Client, handle_file\n\nprint(\'=== ANALYZING THIEME-BECKER IMAGES WITH OCR FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===\')\nprint(\'Objective: Download images and extract text within them to find year dates\')\nprint(\'Target: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\')\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80 + \'\\n\')\n\n# Get workspace directory\nworkspace_files = [f for f in os.listdir(\'.\') if f.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif not workspace_files:\n print(\'‚ùå No workspace directory found\')\n exit()\n\nworkspace_dir = workspace_files[0]\nprint(f\'Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\')\n\n# First, inspect existing analysis files to understand structure\nanalysis_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if \'analysis\' in f and f.endswith(\'.json\')]\nprint(f\'\\nAvailable analysis files: {analysis_files}\')\n\n# Load the enhanced analysis file if available\nimage_data = []\nif analysis_files:\n for analysis_file in analysis_files:\n analysis_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, analysis_file)\n print(f\'\\nInspecting analysis file: {analysis_file}\')\n \n with open(analysis_path, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n analysis_content = json.load(f)\n \n print(\'File structure keys:\')\n for key in analysis_content.keys():\n print(f\' - {key}: {type(analysis_content[key])}\')\n \n # Look for detailed image data\n if \'detailed_image_data\' in analysis_content:\n image_data = analysis_content[\'detailed_image_data\']\n print(f\'\\n‚úì Found detailed image data with {len(image_data)} images\')\n break\n elif \'images_analyzed\' in analysis_content:\n image_data = analysis_content[\'images_analyzed\']\n print(f\'\\n‚úì Found analyzed images data with {len(image_data)} images\')\n break\n\n# If no detailed image data found, extract from HTML\nif not image_data:\n print(\'\\n‚ö† No detailed image data found in analysis files - extracting from HTML\')\n target_html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'target_webpage_content.html\')\n \n if not os.path.exists(target_html_file):\n print(\'‚ùå Target webpage HTML not found\')\n exit()\n \n print(f\'Loading HTML file: {os.path.basename(target_html_file)}\')\n with open(target_html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n \n soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\n print(\'‚úì HTML parsed successfully\')\n \n # Find main content and images\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'})\n if not main_content:\n main_content = soup\n \n img_elements = main_content.find_all(\'img\')\n print(f\'Found {len(img_elements)} <img> elements\')\n \n # Extract image information\n image_data = []\n for i, img in enumerate(img_elements, 1):\n src = img.get(\'src\', \'\')\n \n # Convert relative URLs to absolute\n if src.startswith(\'//\'):\n src = \'https:\' + src\n elif src.startswith(\'/\'):\n src = urljoin(\'https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\', src)\n \n filename = src.split(\'/\')[-1] if \'/\' in src else src\n \n image_data.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'src\': src,\n \'alt\': img.get(\'alt\', \'\'),\n \'title\': img.get(\'title\', \'\'),\n \'filename\': filename\n })\n \n print(f\' Image {i}: {filename}\')\n print(f\' Source: {src[:80]}...\')\n\nprint(f\'\\nüìä Total images to analyze: {len(image_data)}\')\n\nif len(image_data) == 0:\n print(\'‚ùå No images found for analysis\')\n exit()\n\nprint(\'\\n=== DOWNLOADING IMAGES FOR OCR ANALYSIS ===\')\n\n# Create images subdirectory\nimages_dir = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'downloaded_images\')\nos.makedirs(images_dir, exist_ok=True)\nprint(f\'Created/using images directory: {os.path.basename(images_dir)}\')\n\n# Download headers\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.9\'\n}\n\n# Download each image\ndownloaded_images = []\nfor i, img_info in enumerate(image_data, 1):\n print(f\'\\nDownloading Image {i}:\')\n print(f\' Source: {img_info["src"]}\')\n print(f\' Filename: {img_info["filename"]}\')\n \n try:\n response = requests.get(img_info[\'src\'], headers=headers, timeout=30)\n print(f\' Download status: {response.status_code}\')\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n # Determine file extension from content type or URL\n content_type = response.headers.get(\'content-type\', \'\').lower()\n print(f\' Content-Type: {content_type}\')\n \n if \'jpeg\' in content_type or \'jpg\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.jpg\'\n elif \'png\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.png\'\n elif \'gif\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.gif\'\n elif \'svg\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.svg\'\n elif \'webp\' in content_type:\n ext = \'.webp\'\n else:\n # Try to get extension from original filename\n original_filename = img_info[\'filename\']\n if \'.\' in original_filename:\n ext = \'.\' + original_filename.split(\'.\')[-1].split(\'?\')[0]\n else:\n ext = \'.jpg\' # Default\n \n # Create clean local filename\n clean_filename = re.sub(r\'[^\\w\\-_\\.]\', \'_\', img_info[\'filename\'].split(\'?\')[0][:50])\n local_filename = f\'image_{i:02d}_{clean_filename}{ext}\'\n local_path = os.path.join(images_dir, local_filename)\n \n # Save image\n with open(local_path, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(response.content)\n \n file_size = os.path.getsize(local_path)\n print(f\' ‚úì Saved as: {local_filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')\n \n downloaded_images.append({\n \'original_info\': img_info,\n \'local_path\': local_path,\n \'local_filename\': local_filename,\n \'file_size\': file_size,\n \'content_type\': content_type\n })\n else:\n print(f\' ‚ùå Download failed: HTTP {response.status_code}\')\n if response.status_code == 404:\n print(\' Image not found (404)\')\n elif response.status_code == 403:\n print(\' Access forbidden (403)\')\n \n except requests.exceptions.Timeout:\n print(f\' ‚ùå Download timeout for image {i}\')\n except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError:\n print(f\' ‚ùå Connection error for image {i}\')\n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' ‚ùå Download error: {str(e)}\')\n\nprint(f\'\\nüìä Successfully downloaded {len(downloaded_images)} images\')\n\nif len(downloaded_images) == 0:\n print(\'‚ùå No images were downloaded - cannot perform OCR analysis\')\n print(\'This could be due to:\')\n print(\' - Network connectivity issues\')\n print(\' - Archive.org blocking requests\')\n print(\' - Images no longer available at the archived URLs\')\n exit()\n\nprint(\'\\n=== PERFORMING OCR ANALYSIS ON DOWNLOADED IMAGES ===\')\n\n# Initialize OCR client\nprint(\'Initializing Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client...\')\ntry:\n client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR")\n print(\'‚úì OCR client initialized successfully\')\nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f\'‚ùå Failed to initialize OCR client: {str(e)}\')\n print(\'Cannot proceed with OCR analysis\')\n exit()\n\n# Year patterns for chronological date detection\nyear_patterns = [\n r\'\\b(1[0-9]{3})\\b\', # Years 1000-1999\n r\'\\b(20[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 2000-2099\n r\'\\b(19[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1900-1999 (specific)\n r\'\\b(18[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1800-1899\n r\'\\b(17[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1700-1799\n r\'\\b(16[0-9]{2})\\b\', # Years 1600-1699\n r\'\\b(15[0-9]{2})\\b\' # Years 1500-1599\n]\n\n# Analyze each downloaded image with OCR\nall_chronological_years = []\nimage_ocr_results = []\n\nfor i, img_data in enumerate(downloaded_images, 1):\n print(f\'\\nAnalyzing Image {i} with OCR:\')\n print(f\' File: {img_data["local_filename"]}\')\n print(f\' Size: {img_data["file_size"]:,} bytes\')\n print(f\' Type: {img_data["content_type"]}\')\n \n try:\n print(\' Running OCR text extraction...\')\n \n # Perform OCR using Hugging Face Tesseract\n ocr_result = client.predict(\n handle_file(img_data[\'local_path\'])\n )\n \n if ocr_result and ocr_result.strip():\n extracted_text = ocr_result.strip()\n print(f\' ‚úì OCR extracted {len(extracted_text)} characters of text\')\n print(f\' Text preview: "{extracted_text[:150]}..."\')\n \n # Search for chronological years in the extracted text\n found_years = []\n for pattern in year_patterns:\n years_matches = re.findall(pattern, extracted_text)\n if years_matches:\n year_ints = [int(year) for year in years_matches]\n found_years.extend(year_ints)\n print(f\' ‚úì Pattern {pattern} found years: {years_matches}\')\n \n # Remove duplicates and sort\n unique_years = sorted(list(set(found_years)))\n \n if unique_years:\n print(f\' üéØ Chronological years found in image: {unique_years}\')\n all_chronological_years.extend(unique_years)\n else:\n print(f\' ‚ö† No chronological year dates found in OCR text\')\n \n # Store OCR results\n image_ocr_results.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'filename\': img_data[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img_data[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'file_size\': img_data[\'file_size\'],\n \'ocr_text\': extracted_text,\n \'years_found\': unique_years,\n \'text_length\': len(extracted_text),\n \'ocr_success\': True\n })\n \n else:\n print(f\' ‚ö† No text extracted from image (empty OCR result)\')\n image_ocr_results.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'filename\': img_data[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img_data[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'file_size\': img_data[\'file_size\'],\n \'ocr_text\': \'\',\n \'years_found\': [],\n \'text_length\': 0,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'reason\': \'No text detected\'\n })\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f\' ‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(e)}\')\n image_ocr_results.append({\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'filename\': img_data[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_src\': img_data[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'file_size\': img_data[\'file_size\'],\n \'ocr_text\': f\'OCR_ERROR: {str(e)}\',\n \'years_found\': [],\n \'text_length\': 0,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'error\': str(e)\n })\n\n# Process final chronological results\nall_unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_chronological_years)))\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'THIEME-BECKER IMAGE OCR CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\nprint(f\'Images downloaded and analyzed: {len(downloaded_images)}\')\nprint(f\'Images with readable text: {len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r["text_length"] > 0])}\')\nprint(f\'Images containing chronological years: {len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r["years_found"]])}\')\nprint(f\'Total unique chronological years found: {len(all_unique_years)}\')\nprint(f\'All chronological years discovered: {all_unique_years}\')\n\nif all_unique_years:\n latest_year = max(all_unique_years)\n earliest_year = min(all_unique_years)\n \n print(f\'\\nüéØ LATEST (MOST RECENT) CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR FOUND IN IMAGES: {latest_year}\')\n print(f\'üìÖ Earliest chronological year found: {earliest_year}\')\n print(f\'üìä Chronological span: {latest_year - earliest_year} years\')\n \n print(\'\\n=== DETAILED RESULTS BY IMAGE ===\')\n for result in image_ocr_results:\n if result[\'years_found\']:\n print(f\'\\nImage {result["image_number"]} ({result["filename"]}):\')\n print(f\' Years found: {result["years_found"]}\')\n print(f\' OCR text length: {result["text_length"]} characters\')\n if result[\'ocr_text\'] and len(result[\'ocr_text\']) > 0:\n print(f\' Text sample: "{result["ocr_text"][:100]}..."\')\nelse:\n print(f\'\\n‚ö† NO CHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND IN ANY IMAGE CONTENT\')\n print(\'Analysis summary:\')\n for result in image_ocr_results:\n print(f\' Image {result["image_number"]} ({result["filename"]}): \'\n f\'{result["text_length"]} chars, Success: {result["ocr_success"]}\')\n \n print(\'\\nPossible reasons:\')\n print(\' - Images contain no text with chronological dates\')\n print(\' - Text in images is not readable by OCR (stylized fonts, poor resolution)\')\n print(\' - Images are purely visual/decorative without textual information\')\n print(\' - Archive.org compression affected image quality\')\n\n# Create comprehensive OCR analysis report\nocr_analysis_report = {\n \'analysis_info\': {\n \'target_webpage\': \'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\',\n \'webpage_title\': \'Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia (German)\',\n \'analysis_timestamp\': time.strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'analysis_method\': \'OCR text extraction from downloaded image content\',\n \'ocr_service\': \'Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR (kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR)\'\n },\n \'results_summary\': {\n \'total_images_found_on_page\': len(image_data),\n \'images_successfully_downloaded\': len(downloaded_images),\n \'images_with_readable_text\': len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r[\'text_length\'] > 0]),\n \'images_with_chronological_data\': len([r for r in image_ocr_results if r[\'years_found\']]),\n \'total_unique_years_found\': len(all_unique_years),\n \'all_chronological_years\': all_unique_years,\n \'latest_chronological_year\': max(all_unique_years) if all_unique_years else None,\n \'earliest_chronological_year\': min(all_unique_years) if all_unique_years else None,\n \'chronological_span_years\': (max(all_unique_years) - min(all_unique_years)) if len(all_unique_years) > 1 else 0\n },\n \'detailed_image_analysis\': image_ocr_results,\n \'downloaded_images_info\': [{\n \'local_filename\': img[\'local_filename\'],\n \'original_url\': img[\'original_info\'][\'src\'],\n \'file_size_bytes\': img[\'file_size\'],\n \'content_type\': img[\'content_type\']\n } for img in downloaded_images],\n \'methodology\': {\n \'year_detection_patterns\': year_patterns,\n \'year_range_covered\': \'1500-2099\',\n \'ocr_approach\': \'Full text extraction with comprehensive regex pattern matching\',\n \'download_headers_used\': headers\n }\n}\n\n# Save comprehensive analysis\nanalysis_filename = \'thieme_becker_final_chronological_analysis.json\'\nanalysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, analysis_filename)\nwith open(analysis_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(ocr_analysis_report, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f\'\\n‚úì Complete OCR chronological analysis saved to {analysis_filename}\')\n\nprint(\'\\n\' + \'=\'*80)\nprint(\'FINAL PLAN COMPLETION SUMMARY\')\nprint(\'=\'*80)\nprint(\'Objective: Find latest chronological year in images on Thieme-Becker page\')\nprint(\'Method: Download images + OCR text extraction + chronological date detection\')\n\nif all_unique_years:\n final_answer = max(all_unique_years)\n print(f\'\\n*** PLAN OBJECTIVE ACHIEVED ***\')\n print(f\'Latest chronological year found in images: {final_answer}\')\n print(f\'This date was extracted from actual image content using OCR technology\')\n print(f\'Total chronological years discovered: {len(all_unique_years)}\')\n print(f\'Complete list of years: {all_unique_years}\')\nelse:\n print(f\'\\n*** PLAN ANALYSIS COMPLETE - NO CHRONOLOGICAL DATES FOUND ***\')\n print(\'The images on the Thieme-Becker German Wikipedia page do not contain\')\n print(\'readable chronological year dates within their visual content.\')\n print(\'This conclusion is based on comprehensive OCR analysis of all page images.\')\n\nprint(\'\\nWorkspace files created:\')\nfor file in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)):\n if file.endswith((\'.json\', \'.html\', \'.txt\')):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f\'- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')\n\nif os.path.exists(images_dir) and os.listdir(images_dir):\n os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f\'- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)\')',
"description": 'This implementation completes the **PLAN** objective by systematically analyzing the actual visual content within images on the Thieme-Becker webpage to find chronological year dates. The approach includes:\n\n1. **Safe Data Handling**: First inspects existing analysis files to understand their structure before attempting to access keys, following the reminder to avoid blind key access.\n\n2. **Image Extraction**: Extracts image information either from existing analysis files or by parsing the HTML directly, ensuring all images on the page are identified.\n\n3. **Image Download**: Downloads all images from the archived webpage with proper headers and error handling, supporting multiple image formats (JPG, PNG, SVG, GIF, WebP).\n\n4. **OCR Text Extraction**: Uses Hugging Face\'s Tesseract-OCR service to extract any text that is visually embedded within the images themselves - this is the only way to access chronological dates that are "written within" images as specified in the **PLAN**.\n\n5. **Comprehensive Year Detection**: Applies multiple regex patterns to the OCR-extracted text to identify chronological years across different centuries (1500-2099), ensuring no potential dates are missed.\n\n6. **Latest Year Identification**: Determines the most recent chronological year among all dates found within the image content, directly answering the **PLAN** objective to find "the latest (most recent) chronological year".\n\n7. **Detailed Documentation**: Creates comprehensive analysis including OCR results for each image, all chronological years discovered, and complete methodology documentation.\n\nThis OCR-based approach addresses the core requirement because previous HTML metadata analysis found no chronological information, indicating that any year dates must be embedded as visual text within the image content itself. The implementation handles potential failures gracefully and provides clear feedback on whether chronological dates were found or not.',
}
